content: 1 These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each coming with his household:
content_old: 1 These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each coming with his household:

content: 2 Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
content_old: 2 Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;

content: 3 Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
content_old: 3 Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;

content: 4 Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
content_old: 4 Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

content: 5 The total number of persons that were of Jacob’s issue came to seventy, Joseph being already in Egypt.
content_old: 5 The total number of persons that were of Jacob’s issue came to seventy, Joseph being already in Egypt.

content: 6 Joseph died, and all his brothers, and all that generation.
content_old: 6 Joseph died, and all his brothers, and all that generation.

content: 7 But the Israelites were fertile and prolific; they multiplied and increased very greatly, so that the land was filled with them.
content_old: 7 But the Israelites were fertile and prolific; they multiplied and increased very greatly, so that the land was filled with them.

content: 8 A new king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
content_old: 8 A new king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.

content: 9 And he said to his people, “Look, the Israelite people are much too numerous for us.
content_old: 9 And he said to his people, “Look, the Israelite people are much too numerous for us.

content: 10 Let us deal shrewdly with them, so that they may not increase; otherwise in the event of war they may join our enemies in fighting against us and rise from the ground.”
content_old: 10 Let us deal shrewdly with them, so that they may not increase; otherwise in the event of war they may join our enemies in fighting against us and rise from the ground.”

content: 11 So they set taskmasters over them to oppress them with forced labor; and they built garrison cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.
content_old: 11 So they set taskmasters over them to oppress them with forced labor; and they built garrison cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.

content: 12 But the more they were oppressed, the more they increased and spread out, so that theEgyptians came to dread the Israelites.
content_old: 12 But the more they were oppressed, the more they increased and spread out, so that theEgyptians came to dread the Israelites.

content: 13 The Egyptians ruthlessly imposed upon the Israelites
content_old: 13 The Egyptians ruthlessly imposed upon the Israelites

content: 14 the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly they made life bitter for them with harsh labor at mortar and bricks and with all sorts of tasks in the field.
content_old: 14 the various labors that they made them perform. Ruthlessly they made life bitter for them with harsh labor at mortar and bricks and with all sorts of tasks in the field.

content: 15 The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other Puah,
content_old: 15 The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other Puah,

content: 16 saying, “When you deliver the Hebrew women, look at the birthstool: if it is a boy, kill him; if it is a girl, let her live.”
content_old: 16 saying, “When you deliver the Hebrew women, look at the birthstool: if it is a boy, kill him; if it is a girl, let her live.”

content: 17 The midwives, fearing God, did not do as the king of Egypt had told them; they let the boys live.
content_old: 17 The midwives, fearing God, did not do as the king of Egypt had told them; they let the boys live.

content: 18 So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, letting the boys live?”
content_old: 18 So the king of Egypt summoned the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, letting the boys live?”

content: 19 The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women: they are vigorous. Before the midwife can come to them, they have given birth.”
content_old: 19 The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women: they are vigorous. Before the midwife can come to them, they have given birth.”

content: 20 And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied and increased greatly.
content_old: 20 And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied and increased greatly.

content: 21 And because the midwives feared God, He established households for them.
content_old: 21 And because the midwives feared God, He established households for them.

content: 1 A certain man of the house of Levi went and married a Levite woman.
content_old: 1 A certain man of the house of Levi went and married a Levite woman.

content: 2 The woman conceived and bore a son; and when she saw how beautiful he was, she hid him for three months.
content_old: 2 The woman conceived and bore a son; and when she saw how beautiful he was, she hid him for three months.

content: 3 When she could hide him no longer, she got a wicker basket for him and caulked it with bitumen and pitch. She put the child into it and placed it among the reeds by the bank of the Nile.
content_old: 3 When she could hide him no longer, she got a wicker basket for him and caulked it with bitumen and pitch. She put the child into it and placed it among the reeds by the bank of the Nile.

content: 4 And his sister stationed herself at a distance, to learn what would befall him.
content_old: 4 And his sister stationed herself at a distance, to learn what would befall him.

content: 5 The daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the Nile, while her maidens walked along the Nile. She spied the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to fetch it.
content_old: 5 The daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the Nile, while her maidens walked along the Nile. She spied the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to fetch it.

content: 6 When she opened it, she saw that it was a child, a boy crying. She took pity on it and said, “This must be a Hebrew child.”
content_old: 6 When she opened it, she saw that it was a child, a boy crying. She took pity on it and said, “This must be a Hebrew child.”

content: 7 Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and get you a Hebrew nurse to suckle the child for you?”
content_old: 7 Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and get you a Hebrew nurse to suckle the child for you?”

content: 8 And Pharaoh’s daughter answered, “Yes.” So the girl went and called the child’s mother.
content_old: 8 And Pharaoh’s daughter answered, “Yes.” So the girl went and called the child’s mother.

content: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse it for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed it.
content_old: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child and nurse it for me, and I will pay your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed it.

content: 10 When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, who made him her son. She named him Moses, explaining, “I drew him out of the water.”
content_old: 10 When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, who made him her son. She named him Moses, explaining, “I drew him out of the water.”

content: 11 Some time after that, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his kinsfolk and witnessed their labors. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his kinsmen.
content_old: 11 Some time after that, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his kinsfolk and witnessed their labors. He saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his kinsmen.

content: 12 He turned this way and that and, seeing no one about, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand
content_old: 12 He turned this way and that and, seeing no one about, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand

content: 13 When he went out the next day, he found two Hebrews fighting; so he said to the offender, “Why do you strike your fellow?”
content_old: 13 When he went out the next day, he found two Hebrews fighting; so he said to the offender, “Why do you strike your fellow?”

content: 14 He retorted, “Who made you chief and ruler over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was frightened, and thought: Then the matter is known!
content_old: 14 He retorted, “Who made you chief and ruler over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?” Moses was frightened, and thought: Then the matter is known!

content: 15 When Pharaoh learned of the matter, he sought to kill Moses; but Moses fled from Pharaoh. He arrived in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.
content_old: 15 When Pharaoh learned of the matter, he sought to kill Moses; but Moses fled from Pharaoh. He arrived in the land of Midian, and sat down beside a well.

content: 16 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came to draw water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock;
content_old: 16 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. They came to draw water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock;

content: 17 but shepherds came and drove them off. Moses rose to their defense, and he watered their flock.
content_old: 17 but shepherds came and drove them off. Moses rose to their defense, and he watered their flock.

content: 18 When they returned to their father Reuel, he said, “How is it that you have come back so soon today?”
content_old: 18 When they returned to their father Reuel, he said, “How is it that you have come back so soon today?”

content: 19 They answered, “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds; he even drew water for us and watered the flock.”
content_old: 19 They answered, “An Egyptian rescued us from the shepherds; he even drew water for us and watered the flock.”

content: 20 He said to his daughters, “Where is he then? Why did you leave the man? Ask him in to break bread.”
content_old: 20 He said to his daughters, “Where is he then? Why did you leave the man? Ask him in to break bread.”

content: 21 Moses consented to stay with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah as wife.
content_old: 21 Moses consented to stay with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah as wife.

content: 22 She bore a son whom he named Gershom, for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”
content_old: 22 She bore a son whom he named Gershom, for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”

content: 23 A long time after that, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites were groaning under the bondage and cried out; and their cry for help from the bondage rose up to God.
content_old: 23 A long time after that, the king of Egypt died. The Israelites were groaning under the bondage and cried out; and their cry for help from the bondage rose up to God.

content: 24 God heard their moaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.
content_old: 24 God heard their moaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob.

content: 1  Now Moses, tending the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, drove the flock into the wilderness, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
content_old: 1  Now Moses, tending the flock of his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, drove the flock into the wilderness, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.

content: 2 An angel of the LORD appeared to him in a blazing fire out of a bush. He gazed, and there was a bush all aflame, yet the bush was not consumed.
content_old: 2 An angel of the LORD appeared to him in a blazing fire out of a bush. He gazed, and there was a bush all aflame, yet the bush was not consumed.

content: 3 Moses said, “I must turn aside to look at this marvelous sight; why doesn’t the bush burn up?”
content_old: 3 Moses said, “I must turn aside to look at this marvelous sight; why doesn’t the bush burn up?”

content: 4 When the LORD saw that he had turned aside to look, God called to him out of the bush: “Moses! Moses!” He answered, “Here I am.”
content_old: 4 When the LORD saw that he had turned aside to look, God called to him out of the bush: “Moses! Moses!” He answered, “Here I am.”

content: 5 And He said, “Do not come closer. Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground.
content_old: 5 And He said, “Do not come closer. Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place on which you stand is holy ground.

content: 6 I am,” He said, “the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.
content_old: 6 I am,” He said, “the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.

content: 7 And the LORD continued, “I have marked well the plight of My people in Egypt and have heeded their outcry because of their taskmasters; yes, I am mindful of their sufferings.
content_old: 7 And the LORD continued, “I have marked well the plight of My people in Egypt and have heeded their outcry because of their taskmasters; yes, I am mindful of their sufferings.

content: 8 I have come down to rescue them from the Egyptians and to bring them out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey, the region of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
content_old: 8 I have come down to rescue them from the Egyptians and to bring them out of that land to a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey, the region of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

content: 9 Now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me; moreover, I have seen how the Egyptians oppress them.
content_old: 9 Now the cry of the Israelites has reached Me; moreover, I have seen how the Egyptians oppress them.

content: 10 Come, therefore, I will send you to Pharaoh, and you shall free My people, the Israelites, from Egypt.”
content_old: 10 Come, therefore, I will send you to Pharaoh, and you shall free My people, the Israelites, from Egypt.”

content: 11 But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and free the Israelites from Egypt?”
content_old: 11 But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and free the Israelites from Egypt?”

content: 12 And He said, “I will be with you; that shall be your sign that it was I who sent you. And when you have freed the people from Egypt, you shall worship God at this mountain.”
content_old: 12 And He said, “I will be with you; that shall be your sign that it was I who sent you. And when you have freed the people from Egypt, you shall worship God at this mountain.”

content: 13 Moses said to God, “When I come to the Israelites and say to them ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”
content_old: 13 Moses said to God, “When I come to the Israelites and say to them ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they ask me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”

content: 14 And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh.” He continued, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘Ehyeh sent me to you.’ ”
content_old: 14 And God said to Moses, “Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh.” He continued, “Thus shall you say to the Israelites, ‘Ehyeh sent me to you.’ ”

content: 15 And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: The LORD, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you: This shall be My name forever, This My appellation for all eternity.
content_old: 15 And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: The LORD, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you: This shall be My name forever, This My appellation for all eternity.

content: 16 “Go and assemble the elders of Israel and say to them: the LORD, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, has appeared to me and said, ‘I have taken note of you and of what is being done to you in Egypt,
content_old: 16 “Go and assemble the elders of Israel and say to them: the LORD, the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, has appeared to me and said, ‘I have taken note of you and of what is being done to you in Egypt,

content: 17 and I have declared: I will take you out of the misery of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.’
content_old: 17 and I have declared: I will take you out of the misery of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.’

content: 18 They will listen to you; then you shall go with the elders of Israel to the king of Egypt and you shall say to him, ‘The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, manifested Himself to us. Now therefore, let us go a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God.’
content_old: 18 They will listen to you; then you shall go with the elders of Israel to the king of Egypt and you shall say to him, ‘The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, manifested Himself to us. Now therefore, let us go a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God.’

content: 19 Yet I know that the king of Egypt will let you go only because of a greater might.
content_old: 19 Yet I know that the king of Egypt will let you go only because of a greater might.

content: 20 So I will stretch out My hand and smite Egypt with various wonders which I will work upon them; after that he shall let you go.
content_old: 20 So I will stretch out My hand and smite Egypt with various wonders which I will work upon them; after that he shall let you go.

content: 21 And I will dispose the Egyptians favorably toward this people, so that when you go, you will not go away empty-handed.
content_old: 21 And I will dispose the Egyptians favorably toward this people, so that when you go, you will not go away empty-handed.

content: 1 But Moses spoke up and said, “What if they do not believe me and do not listen to me, but say: The LORD did not appear to you?”
content_old: 1 But Moses spoke up and said, “What if they do not believe me and do not listen to me, but say: The LORD did not appear to you?”

content: 2 The LORD said to him, “What is that in your hand?” And he replied, “A rod.”
content_old: 2 The LORD said to him, “What is that in your hand?” And he replied, “A rod.”

content: 3 He said, “Cast it on the ground.” He cast it on the ground and it became a snake; and Moses recoiled from it.
content_old: 3 He said, “Cast it on the ground.” He cast it on the ground and it became a snake; and Moses recoiled from it.

content: 4 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Put out your hand and grasp it by the tail”—he put out his hand and seized it, and it became a rod in his hand—
content_old: 4 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Put out your hand and grasp it by the tail”—he put out his hand and seized it, and it became a rod in his hand—

content: 5 “that they may believe that the LORD, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did appear to you.”
content_old: 5 “that they may believe that the LORD, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, did appear to you.”

content: 6 The LORD said to him further, “Put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom; and when he took it out, his hand was encrusted with snowy scales!
content_old: 6 The LORD said to him further, “Put your hand into your bosom.” He put his hand into his bosom; and when he took it out, his hand was encrusted with snowy scales!

content: 7 And He said, “Put your hand back into your bosom.”—He put his hand back into his bosom; and when he took it out of his bosom, there it was again like the rest of his body.—
content_old: 7 And He said, “Put your hand back into your bosom.”—He put his hand back into his bosom; and when he took it out of his bosom, there it was again like the rest of his body.—

content: 8 “And if they do not believe you or pay heed to the first sign, they will believe the second.
content_old: 8 “And if they do not believe you or pay heed to the first sign, they will believe the second.

content: 9 And if they are not convinced by both these signs and still do not heed you, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and it—the water that you take from the Nile—will turn to blood on the dry ground.”
content_old: 9 And if they are not convinced by both these signs and still do not heed you, take some water from the Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and it—the water that you take from the Nile—will turn to blood on the dry ground.”

content: 10 But Moses said to the LORD, “Please, O Lord, I have never been a man of words, either in times past or now that You have spoken to Your servant; I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
content_old: 10 But Moses said to the LORD, “Please, O Lord, I have never been a man of words, either in times past or now that You have spoken to Your servant; I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”

content: 11 And the LORD said to him, “Who gives man speech? Who makes him dumb or deaf, seeing or blind? Is it not I, the LORD?
content_old: 11 And the LORD said to him, “Who gives man speech? Who makes him dumb or deaf, seeing or blind? Is it not I, the LORD?

content: 12 Now go, and I will be with you as you speak and will instruct you what to say.”
content_old: 12 Now go, and I will be with you as you speak and will instruct you what to say.”

content: 13 But he said, “Please, O Lord, make someone else Your agent.”
content_old: 13 But he said, “Please, O Lord, make someone else Your agent.”

content: 14 The LORD became angry with Moses, and He said, “There is your brother Aaron the Levite. He, I know, speaks readily. Even now he is setting out to meet you, and he will be happy to see you.
content_old: 14 The LORD became angry with Moses, and He said, “There is your brother Aaron the Levite. He, I know, speaks readily. Even now he is setting out to meet you, and he will be happy to see you.

content: 15 You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth—I will be with you and with him as you speak, and tell both of you what to do—
content_old: 15 You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth—I will be with you and with him as you speak, and tell both of you what to do—

content: 16 and he shall speak for you to the people. Thus he shall serve as your spokesman, with you playing the role of God to him,
content_old: 16 and he shall speak for you to the people. Thus he shall serve as your spokesman, with you playing the role of God to him,

content: 17 And take with you this rod, with which you shall perform the signs.”
content_old: 17 And take with you this rod, with which you shall perform the signs.”

content: 18 Moses went back to his father-in-law Jether and said to him, “Let me go back to my kinsmen in Egypt and see how they are faring.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
content_old: 18 Moses went back to his father-in-law Jether and said to him, “Let me go back to my kinsmen in Egypt and see how they are faring.” And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”

content: 19 The LORD said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all the men who sought to kill you are dead.”
content_old: 19 The LORD said to Moses in Midian, “Go back to Egypt, for all the men who sought to kill you are dead.”

content: 20 So Moses took his wife and sons, mounted them on an ass, and went back to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God with him.
content_old: 20 So Moses took his wife and sons, mounted them on an ass, and went back to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God with him.

content: 21 And the LORD said to Moses, “When you return to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the marvels that I have put within your power. I, however, will stiffen his heart so that he will not let the people go.
content_old: 21 And the LORD said to Moses, “When you return to Egypt, see that you perform before Pharaoh all the marvels that I have put within your power. I, however, will stiffen his heart so that he will not let the people go.

content: 22 Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the LORD: Israel is My first-born son.
content_old: 22 Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the LORD: Israel is My first-born son.

content: 23 I have said to you, “Let My son go, that he may worship Me,” yet you refuse to let him go. Now I will slay your first-born son.’ ”
content_old: 23 I have said to you, “Let My son go, that he may worship Me,” yet you refuse to let him go. Now I will slay your first-born son.’ ”

content: 24 At a night encampment on the way, the LORD encountered him and sought to kill him.
content_old: 24 At a night encampment on the way, the LORD encountered him and sought to kill him.

content: 25 So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!”
content_old: 25 So Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son’s foreskin, and touched his legs with it, saying, “You are truly a bridegroom of blood to me!”

content: 26 And when He let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcision.”
content_old: 26 And when He let him alone, she added, “A bridegroom of blood because of the circumcision.”

content: 27 The LORD said to Aaron, “Go to meet Moses in the wilderness.” He went and met him at the mountain of God, and he kissed him.
content_old: 27 The LORD said to Aaron, “Go to meet Moses in the wilderness.” He went and met him at the mountain of God, and he kissed him.

content: 28 Moses told Aaron about all the things that the LORD had committed to him and all the signs about which He had instructed him.
content_old: 28 Moses told Aaron about all the things that the LORD had committed to him and all the signs about which He had instructed him.

content: 29 Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.
content_old: 29 Then Moses and Aaron went and assembled all the elders of the Israelites.

content: 30 Aaron repeated all the words that the LORD had spoken to Moses, and he performed the signs in the sight of the people,
content_old: 30 Aaron repeated all the words that the LORD had spoken to Moses, and he performed the signs in the sight of the people,

content: 1 Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Let My people go that they may celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness.”
content_old: 1 Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Let My people go that they may celebrate a festival for Me in the wilderness.”

content: 2 But Pharaoh said, “Who is the LORD that I should heed Him and let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, nor will I let Israel go.”
content_old: 2 But Pharaoh said, “Who is the LORD that I should heed Him and let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, nor will I let Israel go.”

content: 3 They answered, “The God of the Hebrews has manifested Himself to us. Let us go, we pray, a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God, lest He strike us with pestilence or sword.”
content_old: 3 They answered, “The God of the Hebrews has manifested Himself to us. Let us go, we pray, a distance of three days into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God, lest He strike us with pestilence or sword.”

content: 4 But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you distract the people from their tasks? Get to your labors!”
content_old: 4 But the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you distract the people from their tasks? Get to your labors!”

content: 5 And Pharaoh continued, “The people of the land are already so numerous, and you would have them cease from their labors!”
content_old: 5 And Pharaoh continued, “The people of the land are already so numerous, and you would have them cease from their labors!”

content: 6 That same day Pharaoh charged the taskmasters and foremen of the people, saying,
content_old: 6 That same day Pharaoh charged the taskmasters and foremen of the people, saying,

content: 7 “You shall no longer provide the people with straw for making bricks as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.
content_old: 7 “You shall no longer provide the people with straw for making bricks as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.

content: 8 But impose upon them the same quota of bricks as they have been making heretofore; do not reduce it, for they are shirkers; that is why they cry, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God!’
content_old: 8 But impose upon them the same quota of bricks as they have been making heretofore; do not reduce it, for they are shirkers; that is why they cry, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God!’

content: 9 Let heavier work be laid upon the men; let them keep at it and not pay attention to deceitful promises.”
content_old: 9 Let heavier work be laid upon the men; let them keep at it and not pay attention to deceitful promises.”

content: 10 So the taskmasters and foremen of the people went out and said to the people, “Thus says Pharaoh: I will not give you any straw.
content_old: 10 So the taskmasters and foremen of the people went out and said to the people, “Thus says Pharaoh: I will not give you any straw.

content: 11 You must go and get the straw yourselves wherever you can find it; but there shall be no decrease whatever in your work.”
content_old: 11 You must go and get the straw yourselves wherever you can find it; but there shall be no decrease whatever in your work.”

content: 12 Then the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
content_old: 12 Then the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.

content: 13 And the taskmasters pressed them, saying, “You must complete the same work assignment each day as when you had straw.”
content_old: 13 And the taskmasters pressed them, saying, “You must complete the same work assignment each day as when you had straw.”

content: 14 And the foremen of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten. “Why,” they were asked, “did you not complete the prescribed amount of bricks, either yesterday or today, as you did before?”
content_old: 14 And the foremen of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten. “Why,” they were asked, “did you not complete the prescribed amount of bricks, either yesterday or today, as you did before?”

content: 15 Then the foremen of the Israelites came to Pharaoh and cried: “Why do you deal thus with your servants?
content_old: 15 Then the foremen of the Israelites came to Pharaoh and cried: “Why do you deal thus with your servants?

content: 16 No straw is issued to your servants, yet they demand of us: Make bricks! Thus your servants are being beaten, when the fault is with your own people.”
content_old: 16 No straw is issued to your servants, yet they demand of us: Make bricks! Thus your servants are being beaten, when the fault is with your own people.”

content: 17 He replied, “You are shirkers, shirkers! That is why you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.’
content_old: 17 He replied, “You are shirkers, shirkers! That is why you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.’

content: 18 Be off now to your work! No straw shall be issued to you, but you must produce your quota of bricks!”

content: 19 Now the foremen of the Israelites found themselves in trouble because of the order, “You must not reduce your daily quantity of bricks.”

content: 1 Then the LORD said to Moses, “You shall soon see what I will do to Pharaoh: he shall let them go because of a greater might; indeed, because of a greater might he shall drive them from his land.”

content: 3 I appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as El Shaddai, but I did not make Myself known to them by My name יהוה.

content: 4 I also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they lived as sojourners.

content: 5 I have now heard the moaning of the Israelites because the Egyptians are holding them in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.

content: 6 Say, therefore, to the Israelite people: I am the LORD. I will free you from the labors of the Egyptians and deliver you from their bondage. I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and through extraordinary chastisements.

content: 7 And I will take you to be My people, and I will be your God. And you shall know that I, the LORD, am your God who freed you from the labors of the Egyptians.

content: 8 I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and I will give it to you for a possession, I the LORD.”

content: 9 But when Moses told this to the Israelites, they would not listen to Moses, their spirits crushed by cruel bondage.

content: 14 For this time I will send all My plagues upon your person, and your courtiers, and your people, in order that you may know that there is none like Me in all the world.
content_old: 14 For this time I will send all My plagues upon your person, and your courtiers, and your people, in order that you may know that there is none like Me in all the world.

content: 15 I could have stretched forth My hand and stricken you and your people with pestilence, and you would have been effaced from the earth.
content_old: 15 I could have stretched forth My hand and stricken you and your people with pestilence, and you would have been effaced from the earth.

content: 16 Nevertheless I have spared you for this purpose: in order to show you My power, and in order that My fame may resound throughout the world.
content_old: 16 Nevertheless I have spared you for this purpose: in order to show you My power, and in order that My fame may resound throughout the world.

content: 17 Yet you continue to thwart My people, and do not let them go!
content_old: 17 Yet you continue to thwart My people, and do not let them go!

content: 18 This time tomorrow I will rain down a very heavy hail, such as has not been in Egypt from the day it was founded until now.
content_old: 18 This time tomorrow I will rain down a very heavy hail, such as has not been in Egypt from the day it was founded until now.

content: 19 Therefore, order your livestock and everything you have in the open brought under shelter; every man and beast that is found outside, not having been brought indoors, shall perish when the hail comes down upon them!’ ”
content_old: 19 Therefore, order your livestock and everything you have in the open brought under shelter; every man and beast that is found outside, not having been brought indoors, shall perish when the hail comes down upon them!’ ”

content: 20 Those among Pharaoh’s courtiers who feared the LORD‘s word brought their slaves and livestock indoors to safety;
content_old: 20 Those among Pharaoh’s courtiers who feared the LORD‘s word brought their slaves and livestock indoors to safety;

content: 21 but those who paid no regard to the word of the LORD left their slaves and livestock in the open.
content_old: 21 but those who paid no regard to the word of the LORD left their slaves and livestock in the open.

content: 22 The LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that hail may fall on all the land of Egypt, upon man and beast and all the grasses of the field in the land of Egypt.”
content_old: 22 The LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that hail may fall on all the land of Egypt, upon man and beast and all the grasses of the field in the land of Egypt.”

content: 23 So Moses held out his rod toward the sky, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and fire streamed down to the ground, as the LORD rained down hail upon the land of Egypt.
content_old: 23 So Moses held out his rod toward the sky, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and fire streamed down to the ground, as the LORD rained down hail upon the land of Egypt.

content: 24 The hail was very heavy—fire flashing in the midst of the hail—such as had not fallen on the land of Egypt since it had become a nation.
content_old: 24 The hail was very heavy—fire flashing in the midst of the hail—such as had not fallen on the land of Egypt since it had become a nation.

content: 25 Throughout the land of Egypt the hail struck down all that were in the open, both man and beast; the hail also struck down all the grasses of the field and shattered all the trees of the field.
content_old: 25 Throughout the land of Egypt the hail struck down all that were in the open, both man and beast; the hail also struck down all the grasses of the field and shattered all the trees of the field.

content: 26 Only in the region of Goshen, where the Israelites were, there was no hail.
content_old: 26 Only in the region of Goshen, where the Israelites were, there was no hail.

content: 27 Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said to them, “I stand guilty this time. The LORD is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.
content_old: 27 Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron and said to them, “I stand guilty this time. The LORD is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.

content: 28 Plead with the LORD that there may be an end of God’s thunder and of hail. I will let you go; you need stay no longer.”
content_old: 28 Plead with the LORD that there may be an end of God’s thunder and of hail. I will let you go; you need stay no longer.”

content: 29 Moses said to him, “As I go out of the city, I shall spread out my hands to the LORD; the thunder will cease and the hail will fall no more, so that you may know that the earth is the LORD‘s.
content_old: 29 Moses said to him, “As I go out of the city, I shall spread out my hands to the LORD; the thunder will cease and the hail will fall no more, so that you may know that the earth is the LORD‘s.

content: 30 But I know that you and your courtiers do not yet fear the LORD God.”—
content_old: 30 But I know that you and your courtiers do not yet fear the LORD God.”—

content: 31 Now the flax and barley were ruined, for the barley was in the ear and the flax was in bud;
content_old: 31 Now the flax and barley were ruined, for the barley was in the ear and the flax was in bud;

content: 32 but the wheat and the emmer were not hurt, for they ripen late.—
content_old: 32 but the wheat and the emmer were not hurt, for they ripen late.—

content: 33 Leaving Pharaoh, Moses went outside the city and spread out his hands to the LORD: the thunder and the hail ceased, and no rain came pouring down upon the earth.
content_old: 33 Leaving Pharaoh, Moses went outside the city and spread out his hands to the LORD: the thunder and the hail ceased, and no rain came pouring down upon the earth.

content: 34 But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder had ceased, he became stubborn and reverted to his guilty ways, as did his courtiers.
content_old: 34 But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder had ceased, he became stubborn and reverted to his guilty ways, as did his courtiers.

content: 1 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh. For I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his courtiers, in order that I may display these My signs among them,
content_old: 1 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh. For I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his courtiers, in order that I may display these My signs among them,

content: 2 and that you may recount in the hearing of your sons and of your sons’ sons how I made a mockery of the Egyptians and how I displayed My signs among them—in order that you may know that I am the LORD.”
content_old: 2 and that you may recount in the hearing of your sons and of your sons’ sons how I made a mockery of the Egyptians and how I displayed My signs among them—in order that you may know that I am the LORD.”

content: 3 So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go that they may worship Me.
content_old: 3 So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go that they may worship Me.

content: 4 For if you refuse to let My people go, tomorrow I will bring locusts on your territory.
content_old: 4 For if you refuse to let My people go, tomorrow I will bring locusts on your territory.

content: 5 They shall cover the surface of the land, so that no one will be able to see the land. They shall devour the surviving remnant that was left to you after the hail; and they shall eat away all your trees that grow in the field.
content_old: 5 They shall cover the surface of the land, so that no one will be able to see the land. They shall devour the surviving remnant that was left to you after the hail; and they shall eat away all your trees that grow in the field.

content: 6 Moreover, they shall fill your palaces and the houses of all your courtiers and of all the Egyptians—something that neither your fathers nor fathers’ fathers have seen from the day they appeared on earth to this day.’ ” With that he turned and left Pharaoh’s presence.
content_old: 6 Moreover, they shall fill your palaces and the houses of all your courtiers and of all the Egyptians—something that neither your fathers nor fathers’ fathers have seen from the day they appeared on earth to this day.’ ” With that he turned and left Pharaoh’s presence.

content: 7 Pharaoh’s courtiers said to him, “How long shall this one be a snare to us? Let the men go to worship the LORD their God! Are you not yet aware that Egypt is lost?”
content_old: 7 Pharaoh’s courtiers said to him, “How long shall this one be a snare to us? Let the men go to worship the LORD their God! Are you not yet aware that Egypt is lost?”

content: 8 So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh and he said to them, “Go, worship the LORD your God! Who are the ones to go?”
content_old: 8 So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh and he said to them, “Go, worship the LORD your God! Who are the ones to go?”

content: 9 Moses replied, “We will all go, young and old: we will go with our sons and daughters, our flocks and herds; for we must observe the LORD‘s festival.”
content_old: 9 Moses replied, “We will all go, young and old: we will go with our sons and daughters, our flocks and herds; for we must observe the LORD‘s festival.”

content: 10 But he said to them, “The LORD be with you the same as I mean to let your children go with you! Clearly, you are bent on mischief.
content_old: 10 But he said to them, “The LORD be with you the same as I mean to let your children go with you! Clearly, you are bent on mischief.

content: 11 No! You menfolk go and worship the LORD, since that is what you want.” And they were expelled from Pharaoh’s presence.
content_old: 11 No! You menfolk go and worship the LORD, since that is what you want.” And they were expelled from Pharaoh’s presence.

content: 12 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt and eat up all the grasses in the land, whatever the hail has left.”
content_old: 12 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt and eat up all the grasses in the land, whatever the hail has left.”

content: 13 So Moses held out his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD drove an east wind over the land all that day and all night; and when morning came, the east wind had brought the locusts.
content_old: 13 So Moses held out his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD drove an east wind over the land all that day and all night; and when morning came, the east wind had brought the locusts.

content: 14 Locusts invaded all the land of Egypt and settled within all the territory of Egypt in a thick mass; never before had there been so many, nor will there ever be so many again.
content_old: 14 Locusts invaded all the land of Egypt and settled within all the territory of Egypt in a thick mass; never before had there been so many, nor will there ever be so many again.

content: 15 They hid all the land from view, and the land was darkened; and they ate up all the grasses of the field and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left, so that nothing green was left, of tree or grass of the field, in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 15 They hid all the land from view, and the land was darkened; and they ate up all the grasses of the field and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left, so that nothing green was left, of tree or grass of the field, in all the land of Egypt.

content: 16 Pharaoh hurriedly summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “I stand guilty before the LORD your God and before you.
content_old: 16 Pharaoh hurriedly summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “I stand guilty before the LORD your God and before you.

content: 17 Forgive my offense just this once, and plead with the LORD your God that He but remove this death from me.”
content_old: 17 Forgive my offense just this once, and plead with the LORD your God that He but remove this death from me.”

content: 18 So he left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with the LORD.
content_old: 18 So he left Pharaoh’s presence and pleaded with the LORD.

content: 19 The LORD caused a shift to a very strong west wind, which lifted the locusts and hurled them into the Sea of Reeds; not a single locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.
content_old: 19 The LORD caused a shift to a very strong west wind, which lifted the locusts and hurled them into the Sea of Reeds; not a single locust remained in all the territory of Egypt.

content: 20 But the LORD stiffened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the Israelites go.
content_old: 20 But the LORD stiffened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the Israelites go.

content: 21 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that there may be darkness upon the land of Egypt, a darkness that can be touched.”
content_old: 21 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm toward the sky that there may be darkness upon the land of Egypt, a darkness that can be touched.”

content: 22 Moses held out his arm toward the sky and thick darkness descended upon all the land of Egypt for three days.
content_old: 22 Moses held out his arm toward the sky and thick darkness descended upon all the land of Egypt for three days.

content: 23 People could not see one another, and for three days no one could get up from where he was; but all the Israelites enjoyed light in their dwellings.
content_old: 23 People could not see one another, and for three days no one could get up from where he was; but all the Israelites enjoyed light in their dwellings.

content: 24 Pharaoh then summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship the LORD! Only your flocks and your herds shall be left behind; even your children may go with you.”
content_old: 24 Pharaoh then summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship the LORD! Only your flocks and your herds shall be left behind; even your children may go with you.”

content: 25 But Moses said, “You yourself must provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to offer up to the LORD our God;
content_old: 25 But Moses said, “You yourself must provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to offer up to the LORD our God;

content: 26 our own livestock, too, shall go along with us—not a hoof shall remain behind: for we must select from it for the worship of the LORD our God; and we shall not know with what we are to worship the LORD until we arrive there.”
content_old: 26 our own livestock, too, shall go along with us—not a hoof shall remain behind: for we must select from it for the worship of the LORD our God; and we shall not know with what we are to worship the LORD until we arrive there.”

content: 27 But the LORD stiffened Pharaoh’s heart and he would not agree to let them go.
content_old: 27 But the LORD stiffened Pharaoh’s heart and he would not agree to let them go.

content: 28 Pharaoh said to him, “Be gone from me! Take care not to see me again, for the moment you look upon my face you shall die.”
content_old: 28 Pharaoh said to him, “Be gone from me! Take care not to see me again, for the moment you look upon my face you shall die.”

content: 1 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will bring but one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after that he shall let you go from here; indeed, when he lets you go, he will drive you out of here one and all.
content_old: 1 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will bring but one more plague upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; after that he shall let you go from here; indeed, when he lets you go, he will drive you out of here one and all.

content: 2 Tell the people to borrow, each man from his neighbor and each woman from hers, objects of silver and gold.”
content_old: 2 Tell the people to borrow, each man from his neighbor and each woman from hers, objects of silver and gold.”

content: 3 The LORD disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people. Moreover, Moses himself was much esteemed in the land of Egypt, among Pharaoh’s courtiers and among the people.
content_old: 3 The LORD disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people. Moreover, Moses himself was much esteemed in the land of Egypt, among Pharaoh’s courtiers and among the people.

content: 4 Moses said, “Thus says the LORD: Toward midnight I will go forth among the Egyptians,
content_old: 4 Moses said, “Thus says the LORD: Toward midnight I will go forth among the Egyptians,

content: 5 and every first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sits on his throne to the first-born of the slave girl who is behind the millstones; and all the first-born of the cattle.
content_old: 5 and every first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sits on his throne to the first-born of the slave girl who is behind the millstones; and all the first-born of the cattle.

content: 6 And there shall be a loud cry in all the land of Egypt, such as has never been or will ever be again;
content_old: 6 And there shall be a loud cry in all the land of Egypt, such as has never been or will ever be again;

content: 7 but not a dog shall snarl at any of the Israelites, at man or beast—in order that you may know that the LORD makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.
content_old: 7 but not a dog shall snarl at any of the Israelites, at man or beast—in order that you may know that the LORD makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.

content: 8 Then all these courtiers of yours shall come down to me and bow low to me, saying, ‘Depart, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will depart.” And he left Pharaoh’s presence in hot anger.
content_old: 8 Then all these courtiers of yours shall come down to me and bow low to me, saying, ‘Depart, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will depart.” And he left Pharaoh’s presence in hot anger.

content: 9 Now the LORD had said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, in order that My marvels may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
content_old: 9 Now the LORD had said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, in order that My marvels may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”

content: 1 The LORD said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt:
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt:

content: 2 This month shall mark for you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first of the months of the year for you.
content_old: 2 This month shall mark for you the beginning of the months; it shall be the first of the months of the year for you.

content: 3 Speak to the whole community of Israel and say that on the tenth of this month each of them shall take a lamb to a family, a lamb to a household.
content_old: 3 Speak to the whole community of Israel and say that on the tenth of this month each of them shall take a lamb to a family, a lamb to a household.

content: 4 But if the household is too small for a lamb, let him share one with a neighbor who dwells nearby, in proportion to the number of persons: you shall contribute for the lamb according to what each household will eat.
content_old: 4 But if the household is too small for a lamb, let him share one with a neighbor who dwells nearby, in proportion to the number of persons: you shall contribute for the lamb according to what each household will eat.

content: 5 Your lamb shall be without blemish, a yearling male; you may take it from the sheep or from the goats.
content_old: 5 Your lamb shall be without blemish, a yearling male; you may take it from the sheep or from the goats.

content: 6 You shall keep watch over it until the fourteenth day of this month; and all the assembled congregation of the Israelites shall slaughter it at twilight.
content_old: 6 You shall keep watch over it until the fourteenth day of this month; and all the assembled congregation of the Israelites shall slaughter it at twilight.

content: 7 They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in which they are to eat it.
content_old: 7 They shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in which they are to eat it.

content: 8 They shall eat the flesh that same night; they shall eat it roasted over the fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs.
content_old: 8 They shall eat the flesh that same night; they shall eat it roasted over the fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs.

content: 9 Do not eat any of it raw, or cooked in any way with water, but roasted—head, legs, and entrails—over the fire.
content_old: 9 Do not eat any of it raw, or cooked in any way with water, but roasted—head, legs, and entrails—over the fire.

content: 10 You shall not leave any of it over until morning; if any of it is left until morning, you shall burn it.
content_old: 10 You shall not leave any of it over until morning; if any of it is left until morning, you shall burn it.

content: 11 This is how you shall eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it hurriedly: it is a passover offering to the LORD.
content_old: 11 This is how you shall eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and you shall eat it hurriedly: it is a passover offering to the LORD.

content: 12 For that night I will go through the land of Egypt and strike down every first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and I will mete out punishments to all the gods of Egypt, I the LORD.
content_old: 12 For that night I will go through the land of Egypt and strike down every first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and I will mete out punishments to all the gods of Egypt, I the LORD.

content: 13 And the blood on the houses where you are staying shall be a sign for you: when I see the blood I will pass over you, so that no plague will destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
content_old: 13 And the blood on the houses where you are staying shall be a sign for you: when I see the blood I will pass over you, so that no plague will destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.

content: 14 This day shall be to you one of remembrance: you shall celebrate it as a festival to the LORD throughout the ages; you shall celebrate it as an institution for all time.
content_old: 14 This day shall be to you one of remembrance: you shall celebrate it as a festival to the LORD throughout the ages; you shall celebrate it as an institution for all time.

content: 15 Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; on the very first day you shall remove leaven from your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day to the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
content_old: 15 Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread; on the very first day you shall remove leaven from your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day to the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.

content: 16 You shall celebrate a sacred occasion on the first day, and a sacred occasion on the seventh day; no work at all shall be done on them; only what every person is to eat, that alone may be prepared for you.
content_old: 16 You shall celebrate a sacred occasion on the first day, and a sacred occasion on the seventh day; no work at all shall be done on them; only what every person is to eat, that alone may be prepared for you.

content: 17 You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your ranks out of the land of Egypt; you shall observe this day throughout the ages as an institution for all time.
content_old: 17 You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your ranks out of the land of Egypt; you shall observe this day throughout the ages as an institution for all time.

content: 18 In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
content_old: 18 In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.

content: 19 No leaven shall be found in your houses for seven days. For whoever eats what is leavened, that person shall be cut off from the community of Israel, whether he is a stranger or a citizen of the country.
content_old: 19 No leaven shall be found in your houses for seven days. For whoever eats what is leavened, that person shall be cut off from the community of Israel, whether he is a stranger or a citizen of the country.

content: 20 You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your settlements you shall eat unleavened bread.
content_old: 20 You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your settlements you shall eat unleavened bread.

content: 21 Moses then summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go, pick out lambs for your families, and slaughter the passover offering.
content_old: 21 Moses then summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go, pick out lambs for your families, and slaughter the passover offering.

content: 22 Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply some of the blood that is in the basin to the lintel and to the two doorposts. None of you shall go outside the door of his house until morning.
content_old: 22 Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and apply some of the blood that is in the basin to the lintel and to the two doorposts. None of you shall go outside the door of his house until morning.

content: 23 For when the LORD goes through to smite the Egyptians, He will see the blood on the lintel and the two doorposts, and the LORD will pass over the door and not let the Destroyer enter and smite your home.
content_old: 23 For when the LORD goes through to smite the Egyptians, He will see the blood on the lintel and the two doorposts, and the LORD will pass over the door and not let the Destroyer enter and smite your home.

content: 24 “You shall observe this as an institution for all time, for you and for your descendants.
content_old: 24 “You shall observe this as an institution for all time, for you and for your descendants.

content: 25 And when you enter the land that the LORD will give you, as He has promised, you shall observe this rite.
content_old: 25 And when you enter the land that the LORD will give you, as He has promised, you shall observe this rite.

content: 26 And when your children ask you, ��What do you mean by this rite?’
content_old: 26 And when your children ask you, ��What do you mean by this rite?’

content: 27 you shall say, ‘It is the passover sacrifice to the LORD, because He passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when He smote the Egyptians, but saved our houses.’ ” The people then bowed low in homage.
content_old: 27 you shall say, ‘It is the passover sacrifice to the LORD, because He passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when He smote the Egyptians, but saved our houses.’ ” The people then bowed low in homage.

content: 28 And the Israelites went and did so; just as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
content_old: 28 And the Israelites went and did so; just as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.

content: 29 In the middle of the night the LORD struck down all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sat on the throne to the first-born of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the first-born of the cattle.
content_old: 29 In the middle of the night the LORD struck down all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who sat on the throne to the first-born of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the first-born of the cattle.

content: 30 And Pharaoh arose in the night, with all his courtiers and all the Egyptians—because there was a loud cry in Egypt; for there was no house where there was not someone dead.
content_old: 30 And Pharaoh arose in the night, with all his courtiers and all the Egyptians—because there was a loud cry in Egypt; for there was no house where there was not someone dead.

content: 31 He summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Up, depart from among my people, you and the Israelites with you! Go, worship the LORD as you said!
content_old: 31 He summoned Moses and Aaron in the night and said, “Up, depart from among my people, you and the Israelites with you! Go, worship the LORD as you said!

content: 32 Take also your flocks and your herds, as you said, and begone! And may you bring a blessing upon me also!”
content_old: 32 Take also your flocks and your herds, as you said, and begone! And may you bring a blessing upon me also!”

content: 33 The Egyptians urged the people on, impatient to have them leave the country, for they said, “We shall all be dead.”
content_old: 33 The Egyptians urged the people on, impatient to have them leave the country, for they said, “We shall all be dead.”

content: 34 So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls wrapped in their cloaks upon their shoulders.
content_old: 34 So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls wrapped in their cloaks upon their shoulders.

content: 35 The Israelites had done Moses’ bidding and borrowed from the Egyptians objects of silver and gold, and clothing.
content_old: 35 The Israelites had done Moses’ bidding and borrowed from the Egyptians objects of silver and gold, and clothing.

content: 36 And the LORD had disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people, and they let them have their request; thus they stripped the Egyptians.
content_old: 36 And the LORD had disposed the Egyptians favorably toward the people, and they let them have their request; thus they stripped the Egyptians.

content: 37 The Israelites journeyed from Raamses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, aside from children.
content_old: 37 The Israelites journeyed from Raamses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, aside from children.

content: 38 Moreover, a mixed multitude went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.
content_old: 38 Moreover, a mixed multitude went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.

content: 39 And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had taken out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, since they had been driven out of Egypt and could not delay; nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.
content_old: 39 And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had taken out of Egypt, for it was not leavened, since they had been driven out of Egypt and could not delay; nor had they prepared any provisions for themselves.

content: 40 The length of time that the Israelites lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years;
content_old: 40 The length of time that the Israelites lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years;

content: 41 at the end of the four hundred and thirtieth year, to the very day, all the ranks of the LORD departed from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 41 at the end of the four hundred and thirtieth year, to the very day, all the ranks of the LORD departed from the land of Egypt.

content: 42 That was for the LORD a night of vigil to bring them out of the land of Egypt; that same night is the LORD‘s, one of vigil for all the children of Israel throughout the ages.
content_old: 42 That was for the LORD a night of vigil to bring them out of the land of Egypt; that same night is the LORD‘s, one of vigil for all the children of Israel throughout the ages.

content: 43 The LORD said to Moses and Aaron: This is the law of the passover offering: No foreigner shall eat of it.
content_old: 43 The LORD said to Moses and Aaron: This is the law of the passover offering: No foreigner shall eat of it.

content: 44 But any slave a man has bought may eat of it once he has been circumcised.
content_old: 44 But any slave a man has bought may eat of it once he has been circumcised.

content: 45 No bound or hired laborer shall eat of it.

content: 46 It shall be eaten in one house: you shall not take any of the flesh outside the house; nor shall you break a bone of it.

content: 47 The whole community of Israel shall offer it.

content: 48 If a stranger who dwells with you would offer the passover to the LORD, all his males must be circumcised; then he shall be admitted to offer it; he shall then be as a citizen of the country. But no uncircumcised person may eat of it.

content: 49 There shall be one law for the citizen and for the stranger who dwells among you.

content: 1 The LORD spoke further to Moses, saying,
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke further to Moses, saying,

content: 2 “Consecrate to Me every first-born; man and beast, the first issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”
content_old: 2 “Consecrate to Me every first-born; man and beast, the first issue of every womb among the Israelites is Mine.”

content: 3 And Moses said to the people, “Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how the LORD freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.
content_old: 3 And Moses said to the people, “Remember this day, on which you went free from Egypt, the house of bondage, how the LORD freed you from it with a mighty hand: no leavened bread shall be eaten.

content: 4 You go free on this day, in the month of Abib.
content_old: 4 You go free on this day, in the month of Abib.

content: 5 So, when the LORD has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:
content_old: 5 So, when the LORD has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall observe in this month the following practice:

content: 6 “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of the LORD.
content_old: 6 “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festival of the LORD.

content: 7 Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.
content_old: 7 Throughout the seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten; no leavened bread shall be found with you, and no leaven shall be found in all your territory.

content: 8 And you shall explain to your son on that day, ‘It is because of what the LORD did for me when I went free from Egypt.’
content_old: 8 And you shall explain to your son on that day, ‘It is because of what the LORD did for me when I went free from Egypt.’

content: 9 “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your forehead—in order that the Teaching of the LORD may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand the LORD freed you from Egypt.
content_old: 9 “And this shall serve you as a sign on your hand and as a reminder on your forehead—in order that the Teaching of the LORD may be in your mouth—that with a mighty hand the LORD freed you from Egypt.

content: 10 You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.
content_old: 10 You shall keep this institution at its set time from year to year.

content: 11 “And when the LORD has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as He swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,
content_old: 11 “And when the LORD has brought you into the land of the Canaanites, as He swore to you and to your fathers, and has given it to you,

content: 12 you shall set apart for the LORD every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be the LORD‘s.
content_old: 12 you shall set apart for the LORD every first issue of the womb: every male firstling that your cattle drop shall be the LORD‘s.

content: 13 But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every first-born male among your children.
content_old: 13 But every firstling ass you shall redeem with a sheep; if you do not redeem it, you must break its neck. And you must redeem every first-born male among your children.

content: 14 And when, in time to come, your son asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall say to him, ‘It was with a mighty hand that the LORD brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.
content_old: 14 And when, in time to come, your son asks you, saying, ‘What does this mean?’ you shall say to him, ‘It was with a mighty hand that the LORD brought us out from Egypt, the house of bondage.

content: 15 When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the LORD slew every first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both man and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to the LORD every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every first-born among my sons.’
content_old: 15 When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the LORD slew every first-born in the land of Egypt, the first-born of both man and beast. Therefore I sacrifice to the LORD every first male issue of the womb, but redeem every first-born among my sons.’

content: 16 “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbol on your forehead that with a mighty hand the LORD freed us from Egypt.”
content_old: 16 “And so it shall be as a sign upon your hand and as a symbol on your forehead that with a mighty hand the LORD freed us from Egypt.”

content: 17 Now when Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although it was nearer; for God said, “The people may have a change of heart when they see war, and return to Egypt.”

content: 18 So God led the people roundabout, by way of the wilderness at the Sea of Reeds. Now the Israelites went up armed out of the land of Egypt.

content: 19 And Moses took with him the bones of Joseph, who had exacted an oath from the children of Israel, saying, “God will be sure to take notice of you: then you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”

content: 20 They set out from Succoth, and encamped at Etham, at the edge of the wilderness.

content: 21 The LORD went before them in a pillar of cloud by day, to guide them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, that they might travel day and night.

content: 1 The LORD said to Moses:
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Moses:

content: 2 Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.
content_old: 2 Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.

content: 3 Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, “They are astray in the land; the wilderness has closed in on them.”
content_old: 3 Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, “They are astray in the land; the wilderness has closed in on them.”

content: 4 Then I will stiffen Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them, that I may gain glory through Pharaoh and all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD. And they did so.
content_old: 4 Then I will stiffen Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them, that I may gain glory through Pharaoh and all his host; and the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD. And they did so.

content: 5 When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his courtiers had a change of heart about the people and said, “What is this we have done, releasing Israel from our service?”
content_old: 5 When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his courtiers had a change of heart about the people and said, “What is this we have done, releasing Israel from our service?”

content: 6 He ordered his chariot and took his men with him;
content_old: 6 He ordered his chariot and took his men with him;

content: 7 he took six hundred of his picked chariots, and the rest of the chariots of Egypt, with officers in all of them.
content_old: 7 he took six hundred of his picked chariots, and the rest of the chariots of Egypt, with officers in all of them.

content: 8 The LORD stiffened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he gave chase to the Israelites. As the Israelites were departing defiantly, boldly,
content_old: 8 The LORD stiffened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he gave chase to the Israelites. As the Israelites were departing defiantly, boldly,

content: 9 the Egyptians gave chase to them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and his warriors overtook them encamped by the sea, near Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
content_old: 9 the Egyptians gave chase to them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and his warriors overtook them encamped by the sea, near Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

content: 10 As Pharaoh drew near, the Israelites caught sight of the Egyptians advancing upon them. Greatly frightened, the Israelites cried out to the LORD.
content_old: 10 As Pharaoh drew near, the Israelites caught sight of the Egyptians advancing upon them. Greatly frightened, the Israelites cried out to the LORD.

content: 11 And they said to Moses, “Was it for want of graves in Egypt that you brought us to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us, taking us out of Egypt?
content_old: 11 And they said to Moses, “Was it for want of graves in Egypt that you brought us to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us, taking us out of Egypt?

content: 12 Is this not the very thing we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us be, and we will serve the Egyptians, for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness’?”
content_old: 12 Is this not the very thing we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us be, and we will serve the Egyptians, for it is better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness’?”

content: 13 But Moses said to the people, “Have no fear! Stand by, and witness the deliverance which the LORD will work for you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.
content_old: 13 But Moses said to the people, “Have no fear! Stand by, and witness the deliverance which the LORD will work for you today; for the Egyptians whom you see today you will never see again.

content_old: 15 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Why do you cry out to Me? Tell the Israelites to go forward.

content: 23 The Egyptians came in pursuit after them into the sea, all of Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and horsemen.

content_old: 24 At the morning watch, the LORD looked down upon the Egyptian army from a pillar of fire and cloud, and threw the Egyptian army into panic.

content: 25 He locked the wheels of their chariots so that they moved forward with difficulty. And the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the Israelites, for the LORD is fighting for them against Egypt.”
content_old: 25 He locked the wheels of their chariots so that they moved forward with difficulty. And the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the Israelites, for the LORD is fighting for them against Egypt.”

content: 26 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians and upon their chariots and upon their horsemen.”
content_old: 26 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Hold out your arm over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians and upon their chariots and upon their horsemen.”

content: 27 Moses held out his arm over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state, and the Egyptians fled at its approach. But the LORD hurled the Egyptians into the sea.
content_old: 27 Moses held out his arm over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state, and the Egyptians fled at its approach. But the LORD hurled the Egyptians into the sea.

content: 28 The waters turned back and covered the chariots and the horsemen—Pharaoh’s entire army that followed them into the sea; not one of them remained.
