content: 1 Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the LORD. They said: I will sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously; Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.
content_old: 1 Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the LORD. They said: I will sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously; Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.

content: 2 The LORD is my strength and might; He is become my deliverance. This is my God and I will enshrine Him; The God of my father, and I will exalt Him.
content_old: 2 The LORD is my strength and might; He is become my deliverance. This is my God and I will enshrine Him; The God of my father, and I will exalt Him.

content: 3 The LORD, the Warrior— LORD is His name!
content_old: 3 The LORD, the Warrior— LORD is His name!

content: 4 Pharaoh’s chariots and his army He has cast into the sea; And the pick of his officers Are drowned in the Sea of Reeds.
content_old: 4 Pharaoh’s chariots and his army He has cast into the sea; And the pick of his officers Are drowned in the Sea of Reeds.

content: 5 The deeps covered them; They went down into the depths like a stone.
content_old: 5 The deeps covered them; They went down into the depths like a stone.

content: 6 Your right hand, O LORD, glorious in power, Your right hand, O LORD, shatters the foe!
content_old: 6 Your right hand, O LORD, glorious in power, Your right hand, O LORD, shatters the foe!

content: 7 In Your great triumph You break Your opponents; You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like straw.
content_old: 7 In Your great triumph You break Your opponents; You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like straw.

content: 8 At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up, The floods stood straight like a wall; The deeps froze in the heart of the sea.
content_old: 8 At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up, The floods stood straight like a wall; The deeps froze in the heart of the sea.

content: 9 The foe said, “I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; My desire shall have its fill of them. I will bare my sword— My hand shall subdue them.”
content_old: 9 The foe said, “I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; My desire shall have its fill of them. I will bare my sword— My hand shall subdue them.”

content: 10 You made Your wind blow, the sea covered them; They sank like lead in the majestic waters.
content_old: 10 You made Your wind blow, the sea covered them; They sank like lead in the majestic waters.

content: 11 Who is like You, O LORD, among the celestials; Who is like You, majestic in holiness, Awesome in splendor, working wonders!
content_old: 11 Who is like You, O LORD, among the celestials; Who is like You, majestic in holiness, Awesome in splendor, working wonders!

content: 12 You put out Your right hand, The earth swallowed them.
content_old: 12 You put out Your right hand, The earth swallowed them.

content: 13 In Your love You lead the people You redeemed; In Your strength You guide them to Your holy abode.
content_old: 13 In Your love You lead the people You redeemed; In Your strength You guide them to Your holy abode.

content: 14 The peoples hear, they tremble; Agony grips the dwellers in Philistia.
content_old: 14 The peoples hear, they tremble; Agony grips the dwellers in Philistia.

content: 15 Now are the clans of Edom dismayed; The tribes of Moab—trembling grips them; All the dwellers in Canaan are aghast.
content_old: 15 Now are the clans of Edom dismayed; The tribes of Moab—trembling grips them; All the dwellers in Canaan are aghast.

content: 16 Terror and dread descend upon them; Through the might of Your arm they are still as stone— Till Your people cross over, O LORD, Till Your people cross whom You have ransomed.
content_old: 16 Terror and dread descend upon them; Through the might of Your arm they are still as stone— Till Your people cross over, O LORD, Till Your people cross whom You have ransomed.

content: 17 You will bring them and plant them in Your own mountain, The place You made to dwell in, O LORD, The sanctuary, O LORD, which Your hands established.
content_old: 17 You will bring them and plant them in Your own mountain, The place You made to dwell in, O LORD, The sanctuary, O LORD, which Your hands established.

content: 18 The LORD will reign for ever and ever!
content_old: 18 The LORD will reign for ever and ever!

content: 19 For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and horsemen, went into the sea; and the LORD turned back on them the waters of the sea; but the Israelites marched on dry ground in the midst of the sea.
content_old: 19 For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and horsemen, went into the sea; and the LORD turned back on them the waters of the sea; but the Israelites marched on dry ground in the midst of the sea.

content: 20 Then Miriam the prophetess, Aaron’s sister, took a timbrel in her hand, and all the women went out after her in dance with timbrels.

content: 21 And Miriam chanted for them: Sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously; Horse and driver He has hurled into the sea.

content: 22 Then Moses caused Israel to set out from the Sea of Reeds. They went on into the wilderness of Shur; they traveled three days in the wilderness and found no water.
content_old: 22 Then Moses caused Israel to set out from the Sea of Reeds. They went on into the wilderness of Shur; they traveled three days in the wilderness and found no water.

content: 23 They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; that is why it was named Marah.
content_old: 23 They came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; that is why it was named Marah.

content: 24 And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
content_old: 24 And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”

content: 25 So he cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a piece of wood; he threw it into the water and the water became sweet. There He made for them a fixed rule, and there He put them to the test.

content: 26 He said, “If you will heed the LORD your God diligently, doing what is upright in His sight, giving ear to His commandments and keeping all His laws, then I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon the Egyptians, for I the LORD am your healer.”

content: 1 Setting out from Elim, the whole Israelite community came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 1 Setting out from Elim, the whole Israelite community came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.

content: 2 In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.
content_old: 2 In the wilderness, the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.

content: 3 The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.”
content_old: 3 The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots, when we ate our fill of bread! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to starve this whole congregation to death.”

content: 4 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will rain down bread for you from the sky, and the people shall go out and gather each day that day’s portion—that I may thus test them, to see whether they will follow My instructions or not.
content_old: 4 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will rain down bread for you from the sky, and the people shall go out and gather each day that day’s portion—that I may thus test them, to see whether they will follow My instructions or not.

content: 5 But on the sixth day, when they apportion what they have brought in, it shall prove to be double the amount they gather each day.”
content_old: 5 But on the sixth day, when they apportion what they have brought in, it shall prove to be double the amount they gather each day.”

content: 6 So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “By evening you shall know it was the LORD who brought you out from the land of Egypt;
content_old: 6 So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “By evening you shall know it was the LORD who brought you out from the land of Egypt;

content: 7 and in the morning you shall behold the Presence of the LORD, because He has heard your grumblings against the LORD. For who are we that you should grumble against us?
content_old: 7 and in the morning you shall behold the Presence of the LORD, because He has heard your grumblings against the LORD. For who are we that you should grumble against us?

content: 8 Since it is the LORD,” Moses continued, “who will give you flesh to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full, because the LORD has heard the grumblings you utter against Him, what is our part? Your grumbling is not against us, but against the LORD!”
content_old: 8 Since it is the LORD,” Moses continued, “who will give you flesh to eat in the evening and bread in the morning to the full, because the LORD has heard the grumblings you utter against Him, what is our part? Your grumbling is not against us, but against the LORD!”

content: 9 Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to the whole Israelite community: Advance toward the LORD, for He has heard your grumbling.”
content_old: 9 Then Moses said to Aaron, “Say to the whole Israelite community: Advance toward the LORD, for He has heard your grumbling.”

content: 10 And as Aaron spoke to the whole Israelite community, they turned toward the wilderness, and there, in a cloud, appeared the Presence of the LORD.
content_old: 10 And as Aaron spoke to the whole Israelite community, they turned toward the wilderness, and there, in a cloud, appeared the Presence of the LORD.

content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses:
content_old: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses:

content: 12 “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Speak to them and say: By evening you shall eat flesh, and in the morning you shall have your fill of bread; and you shall know that I the LORD am your God.”
content_old: 12 “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Speak to them and say: By evening you shall eat flesh, and in the morning you shall have your fill of bread; and you shall know that I the LORD am your God.”

content: 13 In the evening quail appeared and covered the camp; in the morning there was a fall of dew about the camp.
content_old: 13 In the evening quail appeared and covered the camp; in the morning there was a fall of dew about the camp.

content: 14 When the fall of dew lifted, there, over the surface of the wilderness, lay a fine and flaky substance, as fine as frost on the ground.
content_old: 14 When the fall of dew lifted, there, over the surface of the wilderness, lay a fine and flaky substance, as fine as frost on the ground.

content: 15 When the Israelites saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?”—for they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “That is the bread which the LORD has given you to eat.
content_old: 15 When the Israelites saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?”—for they did not know what it was. And Moses said to them, “That is the bread which the LORD has given you to eat.

content: 16 This is what the LORD has commanded: Gather as much of it as each of you requires to eat, an omer to a person for as many of you as there are; each of you shall fetch for those in his tent.”
content_old: 16 This is what the LORD has commanded: Gather as much of it as each of you requires to eat, an omer to a person for as many of you as there are; each of you shall fetch for those in his tent.”

content: 17 The Israelites did so, some gathering much, some little.
content_old: 17 The Israelites did so, some gathering much, some little.

content: 18 But when they measured it by the omer, he who had gathered much had no excess, and he who had gathered little had no deficiency: they had gathered as much as they needed to eat.
content_old: 18 But when they measured it by the omer, he who had gathered much had no excess, and he who had gathered little had no deficiency: they had gathered as much as they needed to eat.

content: 19 And Moses said to them, “Let no one leave any of it over until morning.”
content_old: 19 And Moses said to them, “Let no one leave any of it over until morning.”

content: 20 But they paid no attention to Moses; some of them left of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
content_old: 20 But they paid no attention to Moses; some of them left of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and stank. And Moses was angry with them.

content: 21 So they gathered it every morning, each as much as he needed to eat; for when the sun grew hot, it would melt.
content_old: 21 So they gathered it every morning, each as much as he needed to eat; for when the sun grew hot, it would melt.

content: 22 On the sixth day they gathered double the amount of food, two omers for each; and when all the chieftains of the community came and told Moses,
content_old: 22 On the sixth day they gathered double the amount of food, two omers for each; and when all the chieftains of the community came and told Moses,

content: 23 he said to them, “This is what the LORD meant: Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy sabbath of the LORD. Bake what you would bake and boil what you would boil; and all that is left put aside to be kept until morning.”
content_old: 23 he said to them, “This is what the LORD meant: Tomorrow is a day of rest, a holy sabbath of the LORD. Bake what you would bake and boil what you would boil; and all that is left put aside to be kept until morning.”

content: 24 So they put it aside until morning, as Moses had ordered; and it did not turn foul, and there were no maggots in it.
content_old: 24 So they put it aside until morning, as Moses had ordered; and it did not turn foul, and there were no maggots in it.

content: 25 Then Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a sabbath of the LORD; you will not find it today on the plain.
content_old: 25 Then Moses said, “Eat it today, for today is a sabbath of the LORD; you will not find it today on the plain.

content: 26 Six days you shall gather it; on the seventh day, the sabbath, there will be none.”
content_old: 26 Six days you shall gather it; on the seventh day, the sabbath, there will be none.”

content: 27 Yet some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.
content_old: 27 Yet some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found nothing.

content: 28 And the LORD said to Moses, “How long will you men refuse to obey My commandments and My teachings?
content_old: 28 And the LORD said to Moses, “How long will you men refuse to obey My commandments and My teachings?

content: 29 Mark that the LORD has given you the sabbath; therefore He gives you two days’ food on the sixth day. Let everyone remain where he is: let no one leave his place on the seventh day.”
content_old: 29 Mark that the LORD has given you the sabbath; therefore He gives you two days’ food on the sixth day. Let everyone remain where he is: let no one leave his place on the seventh day.”

content: 30 So the people remained inactive on the seventh day.
content_old: 30 So the people remained inactive on the seventh day.

content: 31 The house of Israel named it manna; it was like coriander seed, white, and it tasted like wafers in honey.
content_old: 31 The house of Israel named it manna; it was like coriander seed, white, and it tasted like wafers in honey.

content: 32 Moses said, “This is what the LORD has commanded: Let one omer of it be kept throughout the ages, in order that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out from the land of Egypt.”
content_old: 32 Moses said, “This is what the LORD has commanded: Let one omer of it be kept throughout the ages, in order that they may see the bread that I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out from the land of Egypt.”

content: 33 And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar, put one omer of manna in it, and place it before the LORD, to be kept throughout the ages.”
content_old: 33 And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar, put one omer of manna in it, and place it before the LORD, to be kept throughout the ages.”

content: 34 As the LORD had commanded Moses, Aaron placed it before the Pact, to be kept.
content_old: 34 As the LORD had commanded Moses, Aaron placed it before the Pact, to be kept.

content: 35 And the Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
content_old: 35 And the Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a settled land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.

content: 1 From the wilderness of Sin the whole Israelite community continued by stages as the LORD would command. They encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.
content_old: 1 From the wilderness of Sin the whole Israelite community continued by stages as the LORD would command. They encamped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.

content: 2 The people quarreled with Moses. “Give us water to drink,” they said; and Moses replied to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you try the LORD?”
content_old: 2 The people quarreled with Moses. “Give us water to drink,” they said; and Moses replied to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you try the LORD?”

content: 3 But the people thirsted there for water; and the people grumbled against Moses and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and livestock with thirst?”
content_old: 3 But the people thirsted there for water; and the people grumbled against Moses and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and livestock with thirst?”

content: 4 Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “What shall I do with this people? Before long they will be stoning me!”
content_old: 4 Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “What shall I do with this people? Before long they will be stoning me!”

content: 5 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Pass before the people; take with you some of the elders of Israel, and take along the rod with which you struck the Nile, and set out.
content_old: 5 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Pass before the people; take with you some of the elders of Israel, and take along the rod with which you struck the Nile, and set out.

content: 6 I will be standing there before you on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock and water will issue from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
content_old: 6 I will be standing there before you on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock and water will issue from it, and the people will drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.

content: 7 The place was named Massah and Meribah, because the Israelites quarreled and because they tried the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD present among us or not?”
content_old: 7 The place was named Massah and Meribah, because the Israelites quarreled and because they tried the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD present among us or not?”

content: 8 Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.
content_old: 8 Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.

content: 9 Moses said to Joshua, “Pick some men for us, and go out and do battle with Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill, with the rod of God in my hand.”
content_old: 9 Moses said to Joshua, “Pick some men for us, and go out and do battle with Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill, with the rod of God in my hand.”

content: 10 Joshua did as Moses told him and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
content_old: 10 Joshua did as Moses told him and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

content: 11 Then, whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; but whenever he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
content_old: 11 Then, whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; but whenever he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

content: 12 But Moses’ hands grew heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur, one on each side, supported his hands; thus his hands remained steady until the sun set.
content_old: 12 But Moses’ hands grew heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it, while Aaron and Hur, one on each side, supported his hands; thus his hands remained steady until the sun set.

content: 13 And Joshua overwhelmed the people of Amalek with the sword.
content_old: 13 And Joshua overwhelmed the people of Amalek with the sword.

content: 14 Then the LORD said to Moses, ���Inscribe this in a document as a reminder, and read it aloud to Joshua: I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven!”
content_old: 14 Then the LORD said to Moses, ���Inscribe this in a document as a reminder, and read it aloud to Joshua: I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven!”

content: 15 And Moses built an altar and named it Adonai-nissi.
content_old: 15 And Moses built an altar and named it Adonai-nissi.

content: 1 Jethro priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people, how the LORD had brought Israel out from Egypt.
content_old: 1 Jethro priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people, how the LORD had brought Israel out from Egypt.

content: 2 So Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after she had been sent home,
content_old: 2 So Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after she had been sent home,

content: 3 and her two sons—of whom one was named Gershom, that is to say, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land”;
content_old: 3 and her two sons—of whom one was named Gershom, that is to say, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land”;

content: 4 and the other was named Eliezer, meaning, “The God of my father was my help, and He delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
content_old: 4 and the other was named Eliezer, meaning, “The God of my father was my help, and He delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”

content: 5 Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought Moses’ sons and wife to him in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
content_old: 5 Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought Moses’ sons and wife to him in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.

content: 6 He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, with your wife and her two sons.”
content_old: 6 He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, with your wife and her two sons.”

content: 7 Moses went out to meet his father-in-law; he bowed low and kissed him; each asked after the other’s welfare, and they went into the tent.
content_old: 7 Moses went out to meet his father-in-law; he bowed low and kissed him; each asked after the other’s welfare, and they went into the tent.

content: 8 Moses then recounted to his father-in-law everything that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had befallen them on the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
content_old: 8 Moses then recounted to his father-in-law everything that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships that had befallen them on the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.

content: 9 And Jethro rejoiced over all the kindness that the LORD had shown Israel when He delivered them from the Egyptians.
content_old: 9 And Jethro rejoiced over all the kindness that the LORD had shown Israel when He delivered them from the Egyptians.

content: 10 “Blessed be the LORD,” Jethro said, “who delivered you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
content_old: 10 “Blessed be the LORD,” Jethro said, “who delivered you from the Egyptians and from Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.

content: 11 Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods, yes, by the result of their very schemes against the people.”
content_old: 11 Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods, yes, by the result of their very schemes against the people.”

content: 12 And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to partake of the meal before God with Moses’ father-in-law.
content_old: 12 And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to partake of the meal before God with Moses’ father-in-law.

content: 13 Next day, Moses sat as magistrate among the people, while the people stood about Moses from morning until evening.
content_old: 13 Next day, Moses sat as magistrate among the people, while the people stood about Moses from morning until evening.

content: 14 But when Moses’ father-in-law saw how much he had to do for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing to the people? Why do you act alone, while all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”
content_old: 14 But when Moses’ father-in-law saw how much he had to do for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing to the people? Why do you act alone, while all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”

content: 15 Moses replied to his father-in-law, “It is because the people come to me to inquire of God.
content_old: 15 Moses replied to his father-in-law, “It is because the people come to me to inquire of God.

content: 16 When they have a dispute, it comes before me, and I decide between one person and another, and I make known the laws and teachings of God.”
content_old: 16 When they have a dispute, it comes before me, and I decide between one person and another, and I make known the laws and teachings of God.”

content: 17 But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing you are doing is not right;
content_old: 17 But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing you are doing is not right;

content: 18 you will surely wear yourself out, and these people as well. For the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.
content_old: 18 you will surely wear yourself out, and these people as well. For the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.

content: 19 Now listen to me. I will give you counsel, and God be with you! You represent the people before God: you bring the disputes before God,
content_old: 19 Now listen to me. I will give you counsel, and God be with you! You represent the people before God: you bring the disputes before God,

content: 20 and enjoin upon them the laws and the teachings, and make known to them the way they are to go and the practices they are to follow.
content_old: 20 and enjoin upon them the laws and the teachings, and make known to them the way they are to go and the practices they are to follow.

content: 21 You shall also seek out from among all the people capable men who fear God, trustworthy men who spurn ill-gotten gain. Set these over them as chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and
content_old: 21 You shall also seek out from among all the people capable men who fear God, trustworthy men who spurn ill-gotten gain. Set these over them as chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and

content: 22 let them judge the people at all times. Have them bring every major dispute to you, but let them decide every minor dispute themselves. Make it easier for yourself by letting them share the burden with you.
content_old: 22 let them judge the people at all times. Have them bring every major dispute to you, but let them decide every minor dispute themselves. Make it easier for yourself by letting them share the burden with you.

content: 23 If you do this—and God so commands you—you will be able to bear up; and all these people too will go home unwearied.”
content_old: 23 If you do this—and God so commands you—you will be able to bear up; and all these people too will go home unwearied.”

content: 24 Moses heeded his father-in-law and did just as he had said.
content_old: 24 Moses heeded his father-in-law and did just as he had said.

content: 25 Moses chose capable men out of all Israel, and appointed them heads over the people—chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens;
content_old: 25 Moses chose capable men out of all Israel, and appointed them heads over the people—chiefs of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens;

content: 26 and they judged the people at all times: the difficult matters they would bring to Moses, and all the minor matters they would decide themselves.
content_old: 26 and they judged the people at all times: the difficult matters they would bring to Moses, and all the minor matters they would decide themselves.

content: 1 On the third new moon after the Israelites had gone forth from the land of Egypt, on that very day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.
content_old: 1 On the third new moon after the Israelites had gone forth from the land of Egypt, on that very day, they entered the wilderness of Sinai.

content: 2 Having journeyed from Rephidim, they entered the wilderness of Sinai and encamped in the wilderness. Israel encamped there in front of the mountain,
content_old: 2 Having journeyed from Rephidim, they entered the wilderness of Sinai and encamped in the wilderness. Israel encamped there in front of the mountain,

content: 3 and Moses went up to God. The LORD called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus shall you say to the house of Jacob and declare to the children of Israel:
content_old: 3 and Moses went up to God. The LORD called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus shall you say to the house of Jacob and declare to the children of Israel:

content: 4 ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Me.
content_old: 4 ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Me.

content: 5 Now then, if you will obey Me faithfully and keep My covenant, you shall be My treasured possession among all the peoples. Indeed, all the earth is Mine,
content_old: 5 Now then, if you will obey Me faithfully and keep My covenant, you shall be My treasured possession among all the peoples. Indeed, all the earth is Mine,

content: 6 but you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
content_old: 6 but you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the children of Israel.”

content: 7 Moses came and summoned the elders of the people and put before them all that the LORD had commanded him.
content_old: 7 Moses came and summoned the elders of the people and put before them all that the LORD had commanded him.

content: 8 All the people answered as one, saying, “All that the LORD has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the people’s words to the LORD.
content_old: 8 All the people answered as one, saying, “All that the LORD has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the people’s words to the LORD.

content: 9 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will come to you in a thick cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with you and so trust you ever after.” Then Moses reported the people’s words to the LORD,
content_old: 9 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will come to you in a thick cloud, in order that the people may hear when I speak with you and so trust you ever after.” Then Moses reported the people’s words to the LORD,

content: 10 and the LORD said to Moses, “Go to the people and warn them to stay pure today and tomorrow. Let them wash their clothes.
content_old: 10 and the LORD said to Moses, “Go to the people and warn them to stay pure today and tomorrow. Let them wash their clothes.

content: 11 Let them be ready for the third day; for on the third day the LORD will come down, in the sight of all the people, on Mount Sinai.
content_old: 11 Let them be ready for the third day; for on the third day the LORD will come down, in the sight of all the people, on Mount Sinai.

content: 12 You shall set bounds for the people round about, saying, ‘Beware of going up the mountain or touching the border of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death:
content_old: 12 You shall set bounds for the people round about, saying, ‘Beware of going up the mountain or touching the border of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death:

content: 13 no hand shall touch him, but he shall be either stoned or shot; beast or man, he shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn sounds a long blast, they may go up on the mountain.”
content_old: 13 no hand shall touch him, but he shall be either stoned or shot; beast or man, he shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn sounds a long blast, they may go up on the mountain.”

content: 14 Moses came down from the mountain to the people and warned the people to stay pure, and they washed their clothes.
content_old: 14 Moses came down from the mountain to the people and warned the people to stay pure, and they washed their clothes.

content: 15 And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day: do not go near a woman.”
content_old: 15 And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day: do not go near a woman.”

content: 16 On the third day, as morning dawned, there was thunder, and lightning, and a dense cloud upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the horn; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.
content_old: 16 On the third day, as morning dawned, there was thunder, and lightning, and a dense cloud upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the horn; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.

content: 17 Moses led the people out of the camp toward God, and they took their places at the foot of the mountain.
content_old: 17 Moses led the people out of the camp toward God, and they took their places at the foot of the mountain.

content: 18 Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke, for the LORD had come down upon it in fire; the smoke rose like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain trembled violently.
content_old: 18 Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke, for the LORD had come down upon it in fire; the smoke rose like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain trembled violently.

content: 19 The blare of the horn grew louder and louder. As Moses spoke, God answered him in thunder.
content_old: 19 The blare of the horn grew louder and louder. As Moses spoke, God answered him in thunder.

content: 20 The LORD came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain, and the LORD called Moses to the top of the mountain and Moses went up.
content_old: 20 The LORD came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain, and the LORD called Moses to the top of the mountain and Moses went up.

content: 21 The LORD said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people not to break through to the LORD to gaze, lest many of them perish.
content_old: 21 The LORD said to Moses, “Go down, warn the people not to break through to the LORD to gaze, lest many of them perish.

content: 22 The priests also, who come near the LORD, must stay pure, lest the LORD break out against them.”
content_old: 22 The priests also, who come near the LORD, must stay pure, lest the LORD break out against them.”

content: 23 But Moses said to the LORD, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and sanctify it.’ ”
content_old: 23 But Moses said to the LORD, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and sanctify it.’ ”

content: 24 So the LORD said to him, “Go down, and come back together with Aaron; but let not the priests or the people break through to come up to the LORD, lest He break out against them.”
content_old: 24 So the LORD said to him, “Go down, and come back together with Aaron; but let not the priests or the people break through to come up to the LORD, lest He break out against them.”

content: 1 God spoke all these words, saying:
content_old: 1 God spoke all these words, saying:

content: 2 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:
content_old: 2 I the LORD am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:

content: 3 You shall have no other gods besides Me.
content_old: 3 You shall have no other gods besides Me.

content: 4 You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, or any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters under the earth.
content_old: 4 You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, or any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters under the earth.

content: 5 You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the LORD your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,
content_old: 5 You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I the LORD your God am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,

content: 6 but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
content_old: 6 but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

content: 7 You shall not swear falsely by the name of the LORD your God; for the LORD will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.
content_old: 7 You shall not swear falsely by the name of the LORD your God; for the LORD will not clear one who swears falsely by His name.

content: 8 Remember the sabbath day and keep it holy.
content_old: 8 Remember the sabbath day and keep it holy.

content: 9 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
content_old: 9 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

content: 10 but the seventh day is a sabbath of the LORD your God: you shall not do any work—you, your son or daughter, your male or female slave, or your cattle, or the stranger who is within your settlements.
content_old: 10 but the seventh day is a sabbath of the LORD your God: you shall not do any work—you, your son or daughter, your male or female slave, or your cattle, or the stranger who is within your settlements.

content: 11 For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth and sea, and all that is in them, and He rested on the seventh day; therefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.
content_old: 11 For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth and sea, and all that is in them, and He rested on the seventh day; therefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day and hallowed it.

content: 12 Honor your father and your mother, that you may long endure on the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you.
content_old: 12 Honor your father and your mother, that you may long endure on the land that the LORD your God is assigning to you.

content: 13 You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
content_old: 13 You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

content: 14 You shall not covet your neighbor’s house: you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male or female slave, or his ox or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
content_old: 14 You shall not covet your neighbor’s house: you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male or female slave, or his ox or his ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.

content: 15 All the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the blare of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they fell back and stood at a distance.
content_old: 15 All the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the blare of the horn and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they fell back and stood at a distance.

content: 16 “You speak to us,” they said to Moses, “and we will obey; but let not God speak to us, lest we die.”
content_old: 16 “You speak to us,” they said to Moses, “and we will obey; but let not God speak to us, lest we die.”

content: 17 Moses answered the people, “Be not afraid; for God has come only in order to test you, and in order that the fear of Him may be ever with you, so that you do not go astray.”
content_old: 17 Moses answered the people, “Be not afraid; for God has come only in order to test you, and in order that the fear of Him may be ever with you, so that you do not go astray.”

content: 18 So the people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.
content_old: 18 So the people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.

content: 19 The LORD said to Moses: Thus shall you say to the Israelites: You yourselves saw that I spoke to you from the very heavens:
content_old: 19 The LORD said to Moses: Thus shall you say to the Israelites: You yourselves saw that I spoke to you from the very heavens:

content: 20 With Me, therefore, you shall not make any gods of silver, nor shall you make for yourselves any gods of gold.
content_old: 20 With Me, therefore, you shall not make any gods of silver, nor shall you make for yourselves any gods of gold.

content: 21 Make for Me an altar of earth and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being, your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be mentioned I will come to you and bless you.
content_old: 21 Make for Me an altar of earth and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being, your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be mentioned I will come to you and bless you.

content: 22 And if you make for Me an altar of stones, do not build it of hewn stones; for by wielding your tool upon them you have profaned them.
content_old: 22 And if you make for Me an altar of stones, do not build it of hewn stones; for by wielding your tool upon them you have profaned them.

content: 1 These are the rules that you shall set before them:
content_old: 1 These are the rules that you shall set before them:

content: 2 When you acquire a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years; in the seventh year he shall go free, without payment.
content_old: 2 When you acquire a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years; in the seventh year he shall go free, without payment.

content: 3 If he came single, he shall leave single; if he had a wife, his wife shall leave with him.
content_old: 3 If he came single, he shall leave single; if he had a wife, his wife shall leave with him.

content: 4 If his master gave him a wife, and she has borne him children, the wife and her children shall belong to the master, and he shall leave alone.
content_old: 4 If his master gave him a wife, and she has borne him children, the wife and her children shall belong to the master, and he shall leave alone.

content: 5 But if the slave declares, “I love my master, and my wife and children: I do not wish to go free,”
content_old: 5 But if the slave declares, “I love my master, and my wife and children: I do not wish to go free,”

content: 6 his master shall take him before God. He shall be brought to the door or the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall then remain his slave for life.
content_old: 6 his master shall take him before God. He shall be brought to the door or the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall then remain his slave for life.

content: 7 When a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not be freed as male slaves are.
content_old: 7 When a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not be freed as male slaves are.

content: 8 If she proves to be displeasing to her master, who designated her for himself, he must let her be redeemed; he shall not have the right to sell her to outsiders, since he broke faith with her.
content_old: 8 If she proves to be displeasing to her master, who designated her for himself, he must let her be redeemed; he shall not have the right to sell her to outsiders, since he broke faith with her.

content: 9 And if he designated her for his son, he shall deal with her as is the practice with free maidens.
content_old: 9 And if he designated her for his son, he shall deal with her as is the practice with free maidens.

content: 10 If he marries another, he must not withhold from this one her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.
content_old: 10 If he marries another, he must not withhold from this one her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.

content: 11 If he fails her in these three ways, she shall go free, without payment.
content_old: 11 If he fails her in these three ways, she shall go free, without payment.

content: 12 He who fatally strikes a man shall be put to death.
content_old: 12 He who fatally strikes a man shall be put to death.

content: 13 If he did not do it by design, but it came about by an act of God, I will assign you a place to which he can flee.
content_old: 13 If he did not do it by design, but it came about by an act of God, I will assign you a place to which he can flee.

content: 14 When a man schemes against another and kills him treacherously, you shall take him from My very altar to be put to death.
content_old: 14 When a man schemes against another and kills him treacherously, you shall take him from My very altar to be put to death.

content: 15 He who strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.
content_old: 15 He who strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.

content: 16 He who kidnaps a man—whether he has sold him or is still holding him—shall be put to death.
content_old: 16 He who kidnaps a man—whether he has sold him or is still holding him—shall be put to death.

content: 17 He who insults his father or his mother shall be put to death.
content_old: 17 He who insults his father or his mother shall be put to death.

content: 18 When men quarrel and one strikes the other with stone or fist, and he does not die but has to take to his bed��
content_old: 18 When men quarrel and one strikes the other with stone or fist, and he does not die but has to take to his bed��

content: 19 if he then gets up and walks outdoors upon his staff, the assailant shall go unpunished, except that he must pay for his idleness and his cure.
content_old: 19 if he then gets up and walks outdoors upon his staff, the assailant shall go unpunished, except that he must pay for his idleness and his cure.

content: 20 When a man strikes his slave, male or female, with a rod, and he dies there and then, he must be avenged.
content_old: 20 When a man strikes his slave, male or female, with a rod, and he dies there and then, he must be avenged.

content: 21 But if he survives a day or two, he is not to be avenged, since he is the other’s property.
content_old: 21 But if he survives a day or two, he is not to be avenged, since he is the other’s property.

content: 22 When men fight, and one of them pushes a pregnant woman and a miscarriage results, but no other damage ensues, the one responsible shall be fined according as the woman’s husband may exact from him, the payment to be based on reckoning.
content_old: 22 When men fight, and one of them pushes a pregnant woman and a miscarriage results, but no other damage ensues, the one responsible shall be fined according as the woman’s husband may exact from him, the payment to be based on reckoning.

content: 23 But if other damage ensues, the penalty shall be life for life,
content_old: 23 But if other damage ensues, the penalty shall be life for life,

content: 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
content_old: 24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,

content: 25 burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
content_old: 25 burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.

content: 26 When a man strikes the eye of his slave, male or female, and destroys it, he shall let him go free on account of his eye.
content_old: 26 When a man strikes the eye of his slave, male or female, and destroys it, he shall let him go free on account of his eye.

content: 27 If he knocks out the tooth of his slave, male or female, he shall let him go free on account of his tooth.
content_old: 27 If he knocks out the tooth of his slave, male or female, he shall let him go free on account of his tooth.

content: 28 When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is not to be punished.
content_old: 28 When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox is not to be punished.

content: 29 If, however, that ox has been in the habit of goring, and its owner, though warned, has failed to guard it, and it kills a man or a woman—the ox shall be stoned and its owner, too, shall be put to death.
content_old: 29 If, however, that ox has been in the habit of goring, and its owner, though warned, has failed to guard it, and it kills a man or a woman—the ox shall be stoned and its owner, too, shall be put to death.

content: 30 If ransom is laid upon him, he must pay whatever is laid upon him to redeem his life.
content_old: 30 If ransom is laid upon him, he must pay whatever is laid upon him to redeem his life.

content: 31 So, too, if it gores a minor, male or female,the owner shall be dealt with according to the same rule.
content_old: 31 So, too, if it gores a minor, male or female,the owner shall be dealt with according to the same rule.

content: 32 But if the ox gores a slave, male or female, he shall pay thirty shekels of silver to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.
content_old: 32 But if the ox gores a slave, male or female, he shall pay thirty shekels of silver to the master, and the ox shall be stoned.

content: 33 When a man opens a pit, or digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or an ass falls into it,
content_old: 33 When a man opens a pit, or digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or an ass falls into it,

content: 34 the one responsible for the pit must make restitution; he shall pay the price to the owner, but shall keep the dead animal.
content_old: 34 the one responsible for the pit must make restitution; he shall pay the price to the owner, but shall keep the dead animal.

content: 35 When a man’s ox injures his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; they shall also divide the dead animal.
content_old: 35 When a man’s ox injures his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide its price; they shall also divide the dead animal.

content: 36 If, however, it is known that the ox was in the habit of goring, and its owner has failed to guard it, he must restore ox for ox, but shall keep the dead animal.
content_old: 36 If, however, it is known that the ox was in the habit of goring, and its owner has failed to guard it, he must restore ox for ox, but shall keep the dead animal.

content: 1 If the thief is seized while tunneling, and he is beaten to death, there is no bloodguilt in his case.
content_old: 1 If the thief is seized while tunneling, and he is beaten to death, there is no bloodguilt in his case.

content: 2 If the sun has risen on him, there is bloodguilt in that case.—He must make restitution; if he lacks the means, he shall be sold for his theft.
content_old: 2 If the sun has risen on him, there is bloodguilt in that case.—He must make restitution; if he lacks the means, he shall be sold for his theft.

content: 3 But if what he stole—whether ox or ass or sheep—is found alive in his possession, he shall pay double.
content_old: 3 But if what he stole—whether ox or ass or sheep—is found alive in his possession, he shall pay double.

content: 4 When a man lets his livestock loose to graze in another’s land, and so allows a field or a vineyard to be grazed bare, he must make restitution for the impairment of that field or vineyard.
content_old: 4 When a man lets his livestock loose to graze in another’s land, and so allows a field or a vineyard to be grazed bare, he must make restitution for the impairment of that field or vineyard.

content: 5 When a fire is started and spreads to thorns, so that stacked, standing, or growing grain is consumed, he who started the fire must make restitution.
content_old: 5 When a fire is started and spreads to thorns, so that stacked, standing, or growing grain is consumed, he who started the fire must make restitution.

content: 6 When a man gives money or goods to another for safekeeping, and they are stolen from the man’s house—if the thief is caught, he shall pay double;
content_old: 6 When a man gives money or goods to another for safekeeping, and they are stolen from the man’s house—if the thief is caught, he shall pay double;

content: 7 if the thief is not caught, the owner of the house shall depose before God that he has not laid hands on the other’s property.
content_old: 7 if the thief is not caught, the owner of the house shall depose before God that he has not laid hands on the other’s property.

content: 8 In all charges of misappropriation—pertaining to an ox, an ass, a sheep, a garment, or any other loss, whereof one party alleges, “This is it”—the case of both parties shall come before God: he whom God declares guilty shall pay double to the other.
content_old: 8 In all charges of misappropriation—pertaining to an ox, an ass, a sheep, a garment, or any other loss, whereof one party alleges, “This is it”—the case of both parties shall come before God: he whom God declares guilty shall pay double to the other.

content: 9 When a man gives to another an ass, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to guard, and it dies or is injured or is carried off, with no witness about,
content_old: 9 When a man gives to another an ass, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to guard, and it dies or is injured or is carried off, with no witness about,

content: 10 an oath before the LORD shall decide between the two of them that the one has not laid hands on the property of the other; the owner must acquiesce, and no restitution shall be made.
content_old: 10 an oath before the LORD shall decide between the two of them that the one has not laid hands on the property of the other; the owner must acquiesce, and no restitution shall be made.

content: 11 But if was stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.
content_old: 11 But if was stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.

content: 12 If it was torn by beasts, he shall bring it as evidence; he need not replace what has been torn by beasts.
content_old: 12 If it was torn by beasts, he shall bring it as evidence; he need not replace what has been torn by beasts.

content: 13 When a man borrows an animal from another and it dies or is injured, its owner not being with it, he must make restitution.
content_old: 13 When a man borrows an animal from another and it dies or is injured, its owner not being with it, he must make restitution.

content: 14 If its owner was with it, no restitution need be made; but if it was hired, he is entitled to the hire.
content_old: 14 If its owner was with it, no restitution need be made; but if it was hired, he is entitled to the hire.

content: 15 If a man seduces a virgin for whom the bride-price has not been paid, and lies with her, he must make her his wife by payment of a bride-price.
content_old: 15 If a man seduces a virgin for whom the bride-price has not been paid, and lies with her, he must make her his wife by payment of a bride-price.

content: 16 If her father refuses to give her to him, he must still weigh out silver in accordance with the bride-price for virgins.
content_old: 16 If her father refuses to give her to him, he must still weigh out silver in accordance with the bride-price for virgins.

content: 17 You shall not tolerate a sorceress.
content_old: 17 You shall not tolerate a sorceress.

content: 18 Whoever lies with a beast shall be put to death.
content_old: 18 Whoever lies with a beast shall be put to death.

content: 19 Whoever sacrifices to a god other than the LORD alone shall be proscribed.
content_old: 19 Whoever sacrifices to a god other than the LORD alone shall be proscribed.

content: 20 You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 20 You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

content: 21 You shall not ill-treat any widow or orphan.
content_old: 21 You shall not ill-treat any widow or orphan.

content: 22 If you do mistreat them, I will heed their outcry as soon as they cry out to Me,
content_old: 22 If you do mistreat them, I will heed their outcry as soon as they cry out to Me,

content: 23 and My anger shall blaze forth and I will put you to the sword, and your own wives shall become widows and your children orphans.
content_old: 23 and My anger shall blaze forth and I will put you to the sword, and your own wives shall become widows and your children orphans.

content: 24 If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, do not act toward them as a creditor; exact no interest from them.
content_old: 24 If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, do not act toward them as a creditor; exact no interest from them.

content: 25 If you take your neighbor’s garment in pledge, you must return it to him before the sun sets;
content_old: 25 If you take your neighbor’s garment in pledge, you must return it to him before the sun sets;

content: 26 it is his only clothing, the sole covering for his skin. In what else shall he sleep? Therefore, if he cries out to Me, I will pay heed, for I am compassionate.
content_old: 26 it is his only clothing, the sole covering for his skin. In what else shall he sleep? Therefore, if he cries out to Me, I will pay heed, for I am compassionate.

content: 27 You shall not revile God, nor put a curse upon a chieftain among your people.
content_old: 27 You shall not revile God, nor put a curse upon a chieftain among your people.

content: 28 You shall not put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats. You shall give Me the first-born among your sons.
content_old: 28 You shall not put off the skimming of the first yield of your vats. You shall give Me the first-born among your sons.

content: 29 You shall do the same with your cattle and your flocks: seven days it shall remain with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
content_old: 29 You shall do the same with your cattle and your flocks: seven days it shall remain with its mother; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.

content: 1 You must not carry false rumors; you shall not join hands with the guilty to act as a malicious witness:
content_old: 1 You must not carry false rumors; you shall not join hands with the guilty to act as a malicious witness:

content: 2 You shall neither side with the mighty to do wrong—you shall not give perverse testimony in a dispute so as to pervert it in favor of the mighty—
content_old: 2 You shall neither side with the mighty to do wrong—you shall not give perverse testimony in a dispute so as to pervert it in favor of the mighty—

content: 3 nor shall you show deference to a poor man in his dispute.
content_old: 3 nor shall you show deference to a poor man in his dispute.

content: 4 When you encounter your enemy’s ox or ass wandering, you must take it back to him.
content_old: 4 When you encounter your enemy’s ox or ass wandering, you must take it back to him.

content: 5 When you see the ass of your enemy lying under its burden and would refrain from raising it, you must nevertheless raise it with him.
content_old: 5 When you see the ass of your enemy lying under its burden and would refrain from raising it, you must nevertheless raise it with him.

content: 6 You shall not subvert the rights of your needy in their disputes.
content_old: 6 You shall not subvert the rights of your needy in their disputes.

content: 7 Keep far from a false charge; do not bring death on those who are innocent and in the right, for I will not acquit the wrongdoer.
content_old: 7 Keep far from a false charge; do not bring death on those who are innocent and in the right, for I will not acquit the wrongdoer.

content: 8 Do not take bribes, for bribes blind the clear-sighted and upset the pleas of those who are in the right.
content_old: 8 Do not take bribes, for bribes blind the clear-sighted and upset the pleas of those who are in the right.

content: 9 You shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the feelings of the stranger, having yourselves been strangers in the land of Egypt.
content_old: 9 You shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the feelings of the stranger, having yourselves been strangers in the land of Egypt.

content: 10 Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield;
content_old: 10 Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield;

content: 11 but in the seventh you shall let it rest and lie fallow. Let the needy among your people eat of it, and what they leave let the wild beasts eat. You shall do the same with your vineyards and your olive groves.
content_old: 11 but in the seventh you shall let it rest and lie fallow. Let the needy among your people eat of it, and what they leave let the wild beasts eat. You shall do the same with your vineyards and your olive groves.

content: 12 Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor, in order that your ox and your ass may rest, and that your bondman and the stranger may be refreshed.
content_old: 12 Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor, in order that your ox and your ass may rest, and that your bondman and the stranger may be refreshed.

content: 13 Be on guard concerning all that I have told you. Make no mention of the names of other gods; they shall not be heard on your lips.
content_old: 13 Be on guard concerning all that I have told you. Make no mention of the names of other gods; they shall not be heard on your lips.

content: 14 Three times a year you shall hold a festival for Me:
content_old: 14 Three times a year you shall hold a festival for Me:

content: 15 You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days as I have commanded you—at the set time in the month of Abib, for in it you went forth from Egypt; and none shall appear before Me empty-handed;
content_old: 15 You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread—eating unleavened bread for seven days as I have commanded you—at the set time in the month of Abib, for in it you went forth from Egypt; and none shall appear before Me empty-handed;

content: 16 and the Feast of the Harvest, of the first fruits of your work, of what you sow in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in the results of your work from the field.
content_old: 16 and the Feast of the Harvest, of the first fruits of your work, of what you sow in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in the results of your work from the field.

content: 17 Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign, the LORD.
content_old: 17 Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Sovereign, the LORD.

content: 18 You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the fat of My festal offering shall not be left lying until morning.
content_old: 18 You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with anything leavened; and the fat of My festal offering shall not be left lying until morning.

content: 19 The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
content_old: 19 The choice first fruits of your soil you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.

content: 20 I am sending an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have made ready.
content_old: 20 I am sending an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have made ready.

content: 21 Pay heed to him and obey him. Do not defy him, for he will not pardon your offenses, since My Name is in him;
content_old: 21 Pay heed to him and obey him. Do not defy him, for he will not pardon your offenses, since My Name is in him;

content: 22 but if you obey him and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.
content_old: 22 but if you obey him and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.

content: 23 When My angel goes before you and brings you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I annihilate them,
content_old: 23 When My angel goes before you and brings you to the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I annihilate them,

content: 24 you shall not bow down to their gods in worship or follow their practices, but shall tear them down and smash their pillars to bits.
content_old: 24 you shall not bow down to their gods in worship or follow their practices, but shall tear them down and smash their pillars to bits.

content: 25 You shall serve the LORD your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from your midst.
content_old: 25 You shall serve the LORD your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will remove sickness from your midst.

content: 26 No woman in your land shall miscarry or be barren. I will let you enjoy the full count of your days.
content_old: 26 No woman in your land shall miscarry or be barren. I will let you enjoy the full count of your days.

content: 27 I will send forth My terror before you, and I will throw into panic all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn tail before you.
content_old: 27 I will send forth My terror before you, and I will throw into panic all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn tail before you.

content: 28 I will send a plague ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites.
content_old: 28 I will send a plague ahead of you, and it shall drive out before you the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites.

content: 29 I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt.
content_old: 29 I will not drive them out before you in a single year, lest the land become desolate and the wild beasts multiply to your hurt.

content: 30 I will drive them out before you little by little, until you have increased and possess the land.
content_old: 30 I will drive them out before you little by little, until you have increased and possess the land.

content: 31 I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the Sea of Philistia, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hands, and you will drive them out before you.
content_old: 31 I will set your borders from the Sea of Reeds to the Sea of Philistia, and from the wilderness to the Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hands, and you will drive them out before you.

content: 32 You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.
content_old: 32 You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.

content: 1 Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the LORD, with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel, and bow low from afar.
content_old: 1 Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the LORD, with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel, and bow low from afar.

content: 2 Moses alone shall come near the LORD; but the others shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”
content_old: 2 Moses alone shall come near the LORD; but the others shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”

content: 3 Moses went and repeated to the people all the commands of the LORD and all the rules; and all the people answered with one voice, saying, “All the things that the LORD has commanded we will do!”
content_old: 3 Moses went and repeated to the people all the commands of the LORD and all the rules; and all the people answered with one voice, saying, “All the things that the LORD has commanded we will do!”

content: 4 Moses then wrote down all the commands of the LORD. Early in the morning, he set up an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
content_old: 4 Moses then wrote down all the commands of the LORD. Early in the morning, he set up an altar at the foot of the mountain, with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.

content: 5 He designated some young men among the Israelites, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as offerings of well-being to the LORD.
content_old: 5 He designated some young men among the Israelites, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as offerings of well-being to the LORD.

content: 6 Moses took one part of the blood and put it in basins, and the other part of the blood he dashed against the altar.
content_old: 6 Moses took one part of the blood and put it in basins, and the other part of the blood he dashed against the altar.

content: 7 Then he took the record of the covenant and read it aloud to the people. And they said, “All that the LORD has spoken we will faithfully do!”
content_old: 7 Then he took the record of the covenant and read it aloud to the people. And they said, “All that the LORD has spoken we will faithfully do!”

content: 8 Moses took the blood and dashed it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the LORD now makes with you concerning all these commands.”
content_old: 8 Moses took the blood and dashed it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the LORD now makes with you concerning all these commands.”

content: 9 Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel ascended;
content_old: 9 Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy elders of Israel ascended;

content: 10 and they saw the God of Israel: under His feet there was the likeness of a pavement of sapphire, like the very sky for purity.
content_old: 10 and they saw the God of Israel: under His feet there was the likeness of a pavement of sapphire, like the very sky for purity.

content: 11 Yet He did not raise His hand against the leaders of the Israelites; they beheld God, and they ate and drank.
content_old: 11 Yet He did not raise His hand against the leaders of the Israelites; they beheld God, and they ate and drank.

content: 12 The LORD said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and wait there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the teachings and commandments which I have inscribed to instruct them.”
content_old: 12 The LORD said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and wait there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the teachings and commandments which I have inscribed to instruct them.”

content: 13 So Moses and his attendant Joshua arose, and Moses ascended the mountain of God.
content_old: 13 So Moses and his attendant Joshua arose, and Moses ascended the mountain of God.

content: 14 To the elders he had said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. You have Aaron and Hur with you; let anyone who has a legal matter approach them.”
content_old: 14 To the elders he had said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. You have Aaron and Hur with you; let anyone who has a legal matter approach them.”

content: 15 When Moses had ascended the mountain, the cloud covered the mountain.
content_old: 15 When Moses had ascended the mountain, the cloud covered the mountain.

content: 16 The Presence of the LORD abode on Mount Sinai, and the cloud hid it for six days. On the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
content_old: 16 The Presence of the LORD abode on Mount Sinai, and the cloud hid it for six days. On the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.

content: 17 Now the Presence of the LORD appeared in the sight of the Israelites as a consuming fire on the top of the mountain.
content_old: 17 Now the Presence of the LORD appeared in the sight of the Israelites as a consuming fire on the top of the mountain.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 2 Tell the Israelite people to bring Me gifts; you shall accept gifts for Me from every person whose heart so moves him.
content_old: 2 Tell the Israelite people to bring Me gifts; you shall accept gifts for Me from every person whose heart so moves him.

content: 3 And these are the gifts that you shall accept from them: gold, silver, and copper;
content_old: 3 And these are the gifts that you shall accept from them: gold, silver, and copper;

content: 4 blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair;
content_old: 4 blue, purple, and crimson yarns, fine linen, goats’ hair;

content: 5 tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;
content_old: 5 tanned ram skins, dolphin skins, and acacia wood;

content: 6 oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;
content_old: 6 oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the aromatic incense;

content: 7 lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
content_old: 7 lapis lazuli and other stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.

content: 8 And let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.
content_old: 8 And let them make Me a sanctuary that I may dwell among them.

content: 9 Exactly as I show you—the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings—so shall you make it.
content_old: 9 Exactly as I show you—the pattern of the Tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings—so shall you make it.

content: 10 They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
content_old: 10 They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.

content: 11 Overlay it with pure gold—overlay it inside and out—and make upon it a gold molding round about.
content_old: 11 Overlay it with pure gold—overlay it inside and out—and make upon it a gold molding round about.

content: 12 Cast four gold rings for it, to be attached to its four feet, two rings on one of its side walls and two on the other.
content_old: 12 Cast four gold rings for it, to be attached to its four feet, two rings on one of its side walls and two on the other.

content: 13 Make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold;
content_old: 13 Make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold;

content: 14 then insert the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark, for carrying the ark.
content_old: 14 then insert the poles into the rings on the side walls of the ark, for carrying the ark.

content: 15 The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark: they shall not be removed from it.
content_old: 15 The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark: they shall not be removed from it.

content: 16 And deposit in the Ark the Pact which I will give you.
content_old: 16 And deposit in the Ark the Pact which I will give you.

content: 17 You shall make a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
content_old: 17 You shall make a cover of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.

content: 18 Make two cherubim of gold—make them of hammered work—at the two ends of the cover.
content_old: 18 Make two cherubim of gold—make them of hammered work—at the two ends of the cover.

content: 19 Make one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.
content_old: 19 Make one cherub at one end and the other cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.

content: 20 The cherubim shall have their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They shall confront each other, the faces of the cherubim being turned toward the cover.
content_old: 20 The cherubim shall have their wings spread out above, shielding the cover with their wings. They shall confront each other, the faces of the cherubim being turned toward the cover.

content: 21 Place the cover on top of the Ark, after depositing inside the Ark the Pact that I will give you.
content_old: 21 Place the cover on top of the Ark, after depositing inside the Ark the Pact that I will give you.

content: 22 There I will meet with you, and I will impart to you—from above the cover, from between the two cherubim that are on top of the Ark of the Pact—all that I will command you concerning the Israelite people.
content_old: 22 There I will meet with you, and I will impart to you—from above the cover, from between the two cherubim that are on top of the Ark of the Pact—all that I will command you concerning the Israelite people.

content: 23 You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
content_old: 23 You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.

content: 24 Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.
content_old: 24 Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.

content: 25 Make a rim of a hand’s breadth around it, and make a gold molding for its rim round about.
content_old: 25 Make a rim of a hand’s breadth around it, and make a gold molding for its rim round about.

content: 26 Make four gold rings for it, and attach the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
content_old: 26 Make four gold rings for it, and attach the rings to the four corners at its four legs.

content: 27 The rings shall be next to the rim, as holders for poles to carry the table.
content_old: 27 The rings shall be next to the rim, as holders for poles to carry the table.

content: 28 Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; by these the table shall be carried.
content_old: 28 Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; by these the table shall be carried.

content: 29 Make its bowls, ladles, jars and jugs with which to offer libations; make them of pure gold.
content_old: 29 Make its bowls, ladles, jars and jugs with which to offer libations; make them of pure gold.
