content: 30 And on the table you shall set the bread of display, to be before Me always.
content_old: 30 And on the table you shall set the bread of display, to be before Me always.

content: 31 You shall make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be made of hammered work; its base and its shaft, its cups, calyxes, and petals shall be of one piece.
content_old: 31 You shall make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be made of hammered work; its base and its shaft, its cups, calyxes, and petals shall be of one piece.

content: 32 Six branches shall issue from its sides; three branches from one side of the lampstand and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.
content_old: 32 Six branches shall issue from its sides; three branches from one side of the lampstand and three branches from the other side of the lampstand.

content: 33 On one branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, and on the next branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
content_old: 33 On one branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals, and on the next branch there shall be three cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.

content: 34 And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:
content_old: 34 And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond-blossoms, each with calyx and petals:

content: 35 a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches, and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.
content_old: 35 a calyx, of one piece with it, under a pair of branches; and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the second pair of branches, and a calyx, of one piece with it, under the last pair of branches; so for all six branches issuing from the lampstand.

content: 36 Their calyxes and their stems shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.
content_old: 36 Their calyxes and their stems shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single hammered piece of pure gold.

content: 37 Make its seven lamps—the lamps shall be so mounted as to give the light on its front side—
content_old: 37 Make its seven lamps—the lamps shall be so mounted as to give the light on its front side—

content: 38 and its tongs and fire pans of pure gold.
content_old: 38 and its tongs and fire pans of pure gold.

content: 39 It shall be made, with all these furnishings, out of a talent of pure gold.
content_old: 39 It shall be made, with all these furnishings, out of a talent of pure gold.

content: 1 As for the tabernacle, make it of ten strips of cloth; make these of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with a design of cherubim worked into them.
content_old: 1 As for the tabernacle, make it of ten strips of cloth; make these of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with a design of cherubim worked into them.

content: 2 The length of each cloth shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, all the cloths to have the same measurements.
content_old: 2 The length of each cloth shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, all the cloths to have the same measurements.

content: 3 Five of the cloths shall be joined to one another, and the other five cloths shall be joined to one another.
content_old: 3 Five of the cloths shall be joined to one another, and the other five cloths shall be joined to one another.

content: 4 Make loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set; and do likewise on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:
content_old: 4 Make loops of blue wool on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set; and do likewise on the edge of the outermost cloth of the other set:

content: 5 make fifty loops on the one cloth, and fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops to be opposite one another.
content_old: 5 make fifty loops on the one cloth, and fifty loops on the edge of the end cloth of the other set, the loops to be opposite one another.

content: 6 And make fifty gold clasps, and couple the cloths to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle becomes one whole.
content_old: 6 And make fifty gold clasps, and couple the cloths to one another with the clasps, so that the tabernacle becomes one whole.

content: 7 You shall then make cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; make the cloths eleven in number.
content_old: 7 You shall then make cloths of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; make the cloths eleven in number.

content: 8 The length of each cloth shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, the eleven cloths to have the same measurements.
content_old: 8 The length of each cloth shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each cloth shall be four cubits, the eleven cloths to have the same measurements.

content: 9 Join five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves; and fold over the sixth cloth at the front of the tent.
content_old: 9 Join five of the cloths by themselves, and the other six cloths by themselves; and fold over the sixth cloth at the front of the tent.

content: 10 Make fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the cloth of the other set.
content_old: 10 Make fifty loops on the edge of the outermost cloth of the one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the cloth of the other set.

content: 11 Make fifty copper clasps, and fit the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together so that it becomes one whole.
content_old: 11 Make fifty copper clasps, and fit the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together so that it becomes one whole.

content: 12 As for the overlapping excess of the cloths of the tent, the extra half-cloth shall overlap the back of the tabernacle,
content_old: 12 As for the overlapping excess of the cloths of the tent, the extra half-cloth shall overlap the back of the tabernacle,

content: 13 while the extra cubit at either end of each length of tent cloth shall hang down to the bottom of the two sides of the Tabernacle and cover it.
content_old: 13 while the extra cubit at either end of each length of tent cloth shall hang down to the bottom of the two sides of the Tabernacle and cover it.

content: 14 And make for the tent a covering of tanned ram skins, and a covering of dolphin skins above.
content_old: 14 And make for the tent a covering of tanned ram skins, and a covering of dolphin skins above.

content: 15 You shall make the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.
content_old: 15 You shall make the planks for the Tabernacle of acacia wood, upright.

content: 16 The length of each plank shall be ten cubits and the width of each plank a cubit and a half.
content_old: 16 The length of each plank shall be ten cubits and the width of each plank a cubit and a half.

content: 17 Each plank shall have two tenons, parallel to each other; do the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.
content_old: 17 Each plank shall have two tenons, parallel to each other; do the same with all the planks of the Tabernacle.

content: 18 Of the planks of the Tabernacle, make twenty planks on the south side:
content_old: 18 Of the planks of the Tabernacle, make twenty planks on the south side:

content: 19 making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under the one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;
content_old: 19 making forty silver sockets under the twenty planks, two sockets under the one plank for its two tenons and two sockets under each following plank for its two tenons;

content: 20 and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, on the north side, twenty planks,
content_old: 20 and for the other side wall of the Tabernacle, on the north side, twenty planks,

content: 21 with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under the one plank and two sockets under each following plank.
content_old: 21 with their forty silver sockets, two sockets under the one plank and two sockets under each following plank.

content: 22 And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, make six planks;
content_old: 22 And for the rear of the Tabernacle, to the west, make six planks;

content: 23 and make two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.
content_old: 23 and make two planks for the corners of the Tabernacle at the rear.

content: 24 They shall match at the bottom, and terminate alike at the top inside one ring; thus shall it be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.
content_old: 24 They shall match at the bottom, and terminate alike at the top inside one ring; thus shall it be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.

content: 25 Thus there shall be eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two sockets under the first plank, and two sockets under each of the other planks.
content_old: 25 Thus there shall be eight planks with their sockets of silver: sixteen sockets, two sockets under the first plank, and two sockets under each of the other planks.

content: 26 You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,
content_old: 26 You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the planks of the one side wall of the Tabernacle,

content: 27 five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear to the west.
content_old: 27 five bars for the planks of the other side wall of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the planks of the wall of the Tabernacle at the rear to the west.

content: 28 The center bar halfway up the planks shall run from end to end.
content_old: 28 The center bar halfway up the planks shall run from end to end.

content: 29 Overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and overlay the bars with gold.
content_old: 29 Overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings of gold, as holders for the bars; and overlay the bars with gold.

content: 30 Then set up the Tabernacle according to the manner of it that you were shown on the mountain.
content_old: 30 Then set up the Tabernacle according to the manner of it that you were shown on the mountain.

content: 31 You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen; it shall have a design of cherubim worked into it.
content_old: 31 You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen; it shall have a design of cherubim worked into it.

content: 32 Hang it upon four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and having hooks of gold, in four sockets of silver.
content_old: 32 Hang it upon four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and having hooks of gold, in four sockets of silver.

content: 33 Hang the curtain under the clasps, and carry the Ark of the Pact there, behind the curtain, so that the curtain shall serve you as a partition between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.
content_old: 33 Hang the curtain under the clasps, and carry the Ark of the Pact there, behind the curtain, so that the curtain shall serve you as a partition between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.

content: 34 Place the cover upon the Ark of the Pact in the Holy of Holies.
content_old: 34 Place the cover upon the Ark of the Pact in the Holy of Holies.

content: 35 Place the table outside the curtain, and the lampstand by the south wall of the Tabernacle opposite the table, which is to be placed by the north wall.
content_old: 35 Place the table outside the curtain, and the lampstand by the south wall of the Tabernacle opposite the table, which is to be placed by the north wall.

content: 36 You shall make a screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery.
content_old: 36 You shall make a screen for the entrance of the Tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery.

content: 1 You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.
content_old: 1 You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar is to be square—and three cubits high.

content: 2 Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.
content_old: 2 Make its horns on the four corners, the horns to be of one piece with it; and overlay it with copper.

content: 3 Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.
content_old: 3 Make the pails for removing its ashes, as well as its scrapers, basins, flesh hooks, and fire pans—make all its utensils of copper.

content: 4 Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.
content_old: 4 Make for it a grating of meshwork in copper; and on the mesh make four copper rings at its four corners.

content: 5 Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.
content_old: 5 Set the mesh below, under the ledge of the altar, so that it extends to the middle of the altar.

content: 6 And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.
content_old: 6 And make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.

content: 7 The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
content_old: 7 The poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles remain on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.

content: 8 Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.
content_old: 8 Make it hollow, of boards. As you were shown on the mountain, so shall they be made.

content: 9 You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle: On the south side, a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—
content_old: 9 You shall make the enclosure of the Tabernacle: On the south side, a hundred cubits of hangings of fine twisted linen for the length of the enclosure on that side—

content: 10 with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
content_old: 10 with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.

content: 11 Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.
content_old: 11 Again a hundred cubits of hangings for its length along the north side—with its twenty posts and their twenty sockets of copper, the hooks and bands of the posts to be of silver.

content: 12 For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.
content_old: 12 For the width of the enclosure, on the west side, fifty cubits of hangings, with their ten posts and their ten sockets.

content: 13 For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:
content_old: 13 For the width of the enclosure on the front, or east side, fifty cubits:

content: 14 fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
content_old: 14 fifteen cubits of hangings on the one flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;

content: 15 fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;
content_old: 15 fifteen cubits of hangings on the other flank, with their three posts and their three sockets;

content: 16 and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.
content_old: 16 and for the gate of the enclosure, a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and fine twisted linen, done in embroidery, with their four posts and their four sockets.

content: 17 All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.
content_old: 17 All the posts round the enclosure shall be banded with silver and their hooks shall be of silver; their sockets shall be of copper.

content: 18 The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—with hangings of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:
content_old: 18 The length of the enclosure shall be a hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout; and the height five cubits—with hangings of fine twisted linen. The sockets shall be of copper:

content: 19 all the utensils of the Tabernacle, for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.
content_old: 19 all the utensils of the Tabernacle, for all its service, as well as all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of copper.

content: 20 You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
content_old: 20 You shall further instruct the Israelites to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.

content: 1 You shall bring forward your brother Aaron, with his sons, from among the Israelites, to serve Me as priests: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.
content_old: 1 You shall bring forward your brother Aaron, with his sons, from among the Israelites, to serve Me as priests: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.

content: 2 Make sacral vestments for your brother Aaron, for dignity and adornment.
content_old: 2 Make sacral vestments for your brother Aaron, for dignity and adornment.

content: 3 Next you shall instruct all who are skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill, to make Aaron’s vestments, for consecrating him to serve Me as priest.
content_old: 3 Next you shall instruct all who are skillful, whom I have endowed with the gift of skill, to make Aaron’s vestments, for consecrating him to serve Me as priest.

content: 4 These are the vestments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a fringed tunic, a headdress, and a sash. They shall make those sacral vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons, for priestly service to Me;
content_old: 4 These are the vestments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a fringed tunic, a headdress, and a sash. They shall make those sacral vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons, for priestly service to Me;

content: 5 they, therefore, shall receive the gold, the blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and the fine linen.
content_old: 5 they, therefore, shall receive the gold, the blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and the fine linen.

content: 6 They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, worked into designs.
content_old: 6 They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, worked into designs.

content: 7 It shall have two shoulder-pieces attached; they shall be attached at its two ends.
content_old: 7 It shall have two shoulder-pieces attached; they shall be attached at its two ends.

content: 8 And the decorated band that is upon it shall be made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
content_old: 8 And the decorated band that is upon it shall be made like it, of one piece with it: of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.

content: 9 Then take two lazuli stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
content_old: 9 Then take two lazuli stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:

content: 10 six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
content_old: 10 six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.

content: 11 On the two stones you shall make seal engravings—the work of a lapidary—of the names of the sons of Israel. Having bordered them with frames of gold,
content_old: 11 On the two stones you shall make seal engravings—the work of a lapidary—of the names of the sons of Israel. Having bordered them with frames of gold,

content: 12 attach the two stones to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones for remembrance of the Israelite people, whose names Aaron shall carry upon his two shoulder-pieces for remembrance before the LORD.
content_old: 12 attach the two stones to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, as stones for remembrance of the Israelite people, whose names Aaron shall carry upon his two shoulder-pieces for remembrance before the LORD.

content: 13 Then make frames of gold
content_old: 13 Then make frames of gold

content: 14 and two chains of pure gold; braid these like corded work, and fasten the corded chains to the frames.
content_old: 14 and two chains of pure gold; braid these like corded work, and fasten the corded chains to the frames.

content: 15 You shall make a breastpiece of decision, worked into a design; make it in the style of the ephod: make it of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
content_old: 15 You shall make a breastpiece of decision, worked into a design; make it in the style of the ephod: make it of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.

content: 16 It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.
content_old: 16 It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.

content: 17 Set in it mounted stones, in four rows of stones. The first row shall be a row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;
content_old: 17 Set in it mounted stones, in four rows of stones. The first row shall be a row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald;

content: 18 the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;
content_old: 18 the second row: a turquoise, a sapphire, and an amethyst;

content: 19 the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;
content_old: 19 the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and a crystal;

content: 20 and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They shall be framed with gold in their mountings.
content_old: 20 and the fourth row: a beryl, a lapis lazuli, and a jasper. They shall be framed with gold in their mountings.

content: 21 The stones shall correspond to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names. They shall be engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
content_old: 21 The stones shall correspond to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, corresponding to their names. They shall be engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.

content: 22 On the breastpiece make braided chains of corded work in pure gold.
content_old: 22 On the breastpiece make braided chains of corded work in pure gold.

content: 23 Make two rings of gold on the breastpiece, and fasten the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,
content_old: 23 Make two rings of gold on the breastpiece, and fasten the two rings at the two ends of the breastpiece,

content: 24 attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
content_old: 24 attaching the two golden cords to the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.

content: 25 Then fasten the two ends of the cords to the two frames, which you shall attach to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.
content_old: 25 Then fasten the two ends of the cords to the two frames, which you shall attach to the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, at the front.

content: 26 Make two rings of gold and attach them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faces the ephod.
content_old: 26 Make two rings of gold and attach them to the two ends of the breastpiece, at its inner edge, which faces the ephod.

content: 27 And make two other rings of gold and fasten them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.
content_old: 27 And make two other rings of gold and fasten them on the front of the ephod, low on the two shoulder-pieces, close to its seam above the decorated band.

content: 28 The breastpiece shall be held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rests on the decorated band and does not come loose from the ephod.
content_old: 28 The breastpiece shall be held in place by a cord of blue from its rings to the rings of the ephod, so that the breastpiece rests on the decorated band and does not come loose from the ephod.

content: 29 Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel on the breastpiece of decision over his heart, when he enters the sanctuary, for remembrance before the LORD at all times.
content_old: 29 Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel on the breastpiece of decision over his heart, when he enters the sanctuary, for remembrance before the LORD at all times.

content: 30 Inside the breastpiece of decision you shall place the Urim and Thummim, so that they are over Aaron’s heart when he comes before the LORD. Thus Aaron shall carry the instrument of decision for the Israelites over his heart before the LORD at all times.
content_old: 30 Inside the breastpiece of decision you shall place the Urim and Thummim, so that they are over Aaron’s heart when he comes before the LORD. Thus Aaron shall carry the instrument of decision for the Israelites over his heart before the LORD at all times.

content: 31 You shall make the robe of the ephod of pure blue.
content_old: 31 You shall make the robe of the ephod of pure blue.

content: 32 The opening for the head shall be in the middle of it; the opening shall have a binding of woven work round about—it shall be like the opening of a coat of mail—so that it does not tear.
content_old: 32 The opening for the head shall be in the middle of it; the opening shall have a binding of woven work round about—it shall be like the opening of a coat of mail—so that it does not tear.

content: 33 On its hem make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the hem, with bells of gold between them all around:
content_old: 33 On its hem make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the hem, with bells of gold between them all around:

content: 34 a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe.
content_old: 34 a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around the hem of the robe.

content: 35 Aaron shall wear it while officiating, so that the sound of it is heard when he comes into the sanctuary before the LORD and when he goes out—that he may not die.
content_old: 35 Aaron shall wear it while officiating, so that the sound of it is heard when he comes into the sanctuary before the LORD and when he goes out—that he may not die.

content: 36 You shall make a frontlet of pure gold and engrave on it the seal inscription: “Holy to the LORD.”
content_old: 36 You shall make a frontlet of pure gold and engrave on it the seal inscription: “Holy to the LORD.”

content: 37 Suspend it on a cord of blue, so that it may remain on the headdress; it shall remain on the front of the headdress.
content_old: 37 Suspend it on a cord of blue, so that it may remain on the headdress; it shall remain on the front of the headdress.

content: 38 It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may take away any sin arising from the holy things that the Israelites consecrate, from any of their sacred donations; it shall be on his forehead at all times, to win acceptance for them before the LORD.
content_old: 38 It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may take away any sin arising from the holy things that the Israelites consecrate, from any of their sacred donations; it shall be on his forehead at all times, to win acceptance for them before the LORD.

content: 39 You shall make the fringed tunic of fine linen. You shall make the headdress of fine linen. You shall make the sash of embroidered work.
content_old: 39 You shall make the fringed tunic of fine linen. You shall make the headdress of fine linen. You shall make the sash of embroidered work.

content: 40 And for Aaron’s sons also you shall make tunics, and make sashes for them, and make turbans for them, for dignity and adornment.
content_old: 40 And for Aaron’s sons also you shall make tunics, and make sashes for them, and make turbans for them, for dignity and adornment.

content: 41 Put these on your brother Aaron and on his sons as well; anoint them, and ordain them and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.
content_old: 41 Put these on your brother Aaron and on his sons as well; anoint them, and ordain them and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.

content: 42 You shall also make for them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; they shall extend from the hips to the thighs.
content_old: 42 You shall also make for them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; they shall extend from the hips to the thighs.

content: 1 This is what you shall do to them in consecrating them to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull of the herd and two rams without blemish;
content_old: 1 This is what you shall do to them in consecrating them to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull of the herd and two rams without blemish;

content: 2 also unleavened bread, unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil—make these of choice wheat flour.
content_old: 2 also unleavened bread, unleavened cakes with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil—make these of choice wheat flour.

content: 3 Place these in one basket and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.
content_old: 3 Place these in one basket and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.

content: 4 Lead Aaron and his sons up to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.
content_old: 4 Lead Aaron and his sons up to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and wash them with water.

content: 5 Then take the vestments, and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod.
content_old: 5 Then take the vestments, and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod.

content: 6 Put the headdress on his head, and place the holy diadem upon the headdress.
content_old: 6 Put the headdress on his head, and place the holy diadem upon the headdress.

content: 7 Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
content_old: 7 Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.

content: 8 Then bring his sons forward; clothe them with tunics
content_old: 8 Then bring his sons forward; clothe them with tunics

content: 9 and wind turbans upon them. And gird both Aaron and his sons with sashes. And so they shall have priesthood as their right for all time. You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.
content_old: 9 and wind turbans upon them. And gird both Aaron and his sons with sashes. And so they shall have priesthood as their right for all time. You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.

content: 10 Lead the bull up to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the head of the bull.
content_old: 10 Lead the bull up to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the head of the bull.

content: 11 Slaughter the bull before the LORD, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
content_old: 11 Slaughter the bull before the LORD, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,

content: 12 and take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
content_old: 12 and take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.

content: 13 Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and turn them into smoke upon the altar.
content_old: 13 Take all the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, and the two kidneys with the fat on them, and turn them into smoke upon the altar.

content: 14 The rest of the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its dung shall be put to the fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
content_old: 14 The rest of the flesh of the bull, its hide, and its dung shall be put to the fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.

content: 15 Next take the one ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
content_old: 15 Next take the one ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.

content: 16 Slaughter the ram, and take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.
content_old: 16 Slaughter the ram, and take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.

content: 17 Cut up the ram into sections, wash its entrails and legs, and put them with its quarters and its head.
content_old: 17 Cut up the ram into sections, wash its entrails and legs, and put them with its quarters and its head.

content: 18 Turn all of the ram into smoke upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to the LORD, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 18 Turn all of the ram into smoke upon the altar. It is a burnt offering to the LORD, a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 19 Then take the other ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.
content_old: 19 Then take the other ram, and let Aaron and his sons lay their hands upon the ram’s head.

content: 20 Slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear and on the ridges of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and dash the rest of the blood against every side of the altar round about.
content_old: 20 Slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear and on the ridges of his sons’ right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and dash the rest of the blood against every side of the altar round about.

content: 21 Take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle upon Aaron and his vestments, and also upon his sons and his sons’ vestments. Thus shall he and his vestments be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments.
content_old: 21 Take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle upon Aaron and his vestments, and also upon his sons and his sons’ vestments. Thus shall he and his vestments be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments.

content: 22 You shall take from the ram the fat parts—the broad tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them—and the right thigh; for this is a ram of ordination.
content_old: 22 You shall take from the ram the fat parts—the broad tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the protuberance on the liver, the two kidneys with the fat on them—and the right thigh; for this is a ram of ordination.

content: 23 Add one flat loaf of bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, from the basket of unleavened bread that is before the LORD.
content_old: 23 Add one flat loaf of bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, from the basket of unleavened bread that is before the LORD.

content: 24 Place all these on the palms of Aaron and his sons, and offer them as an elevation offering before the LORD.
content_old: 24 Place all these on the palms of Aaron and his sons, and offer them as an elevation offering before the LORD.

content: 25 Take them from their hands and turn them into smoke upon the altar with the burnt offering, as a pleasing odor before the LORD; it is an offering by fire to the LORD.
content_old: 25 Take them from their hands and turn them into smoke upon the altar with the burnt offering, as a pleasing odor before the LORD; it is an offering by fire to the LORD.

content: 26 Then take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and offer it as an elevation offering before the LORD; it shall be your portion.
content_old: 26 Then take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination and offer it as an elevation offering before the LORD; it shall be your portion.

content: 27 You shall consecrate the breast that was offered as an elevation offering and the thigh that was offered as a gift offering from the ram of ordination—from that which was Aaron’s and from that which was his sons’—
content_old: 27 You shall consecrate the breast that was offered as an elevation offering and the thigh that was offered as a gift offering from the ram of ordination—from that which was Aaron’s and from that which was his sons’—

content: 28 and those parts shall be a due for all time from the Israelites to Aaron and his descendants. For they are a gift; and so shall they be a gift from the Israelites, their gift to the LORD out of their sacrifices of well-being.
content_old: 28 and those parts shall be a due for all time from the Israelites to Aaron and his descendants. For they are a gift; and so shall they be a gift from the Israelites, their gift to the LORD out of their sacrifices of well-being.

content: 29 The sacral vestments of Aaron shall pass on to his sons after him, for them to be anointed and ordained in.
content_old: 29 The sacral vestments of Aaron shall pass on to his sons after him, for them to be anointed and ordained in.

content: 30 He among his sons who becomes priest in his stead, who enters the Tent of Meeting to officiate within the sanctuary, shall wear them seven days.
content_old: 30 He among his sons who becomes priest in his stead, who enters the Tent of Meeting to officiate within the sanctuary, shall wear them seven days.

content: 31 You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in the sacred precinct;
content_old: 31 You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in the sacred precinct;

content: 32 and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
content_old: 32 and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

content: 33 These things shall be eaten only by those for whom expiation was made with them when they were ordained and consecrated; they may not be eaten by a layman, for they are holy.
content_old: 33 These things shall be eaten only by those for whom expiation was made with them when they were ordained and consecrated; they may not be eaten by a layman, for they are holy.

content: 34 And if any of the flesh of ordination, or any of the bread, is left until morning, you shall put what is left to the fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy.
content_old: 34 And if any of the flesh of ordination, or any of the bread, is left until morning, you shall put what is left to the fire; it shall not be eaten, for it is holy.

content: 35 Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, just as I have commanded you. You shall ordain them through seven days,
content_old: 35 Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, just as I have commanded you. You shall ordain them through seven days,

content: 36 and each day you shall prepare a bull as a sin offering for expiation; you shall purge the altar by performing purification upon it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.
content_old: 36 and each day you shall prepare a bull as a sin offering for expiation; you shall purge the altar by performing purification upon it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.

content: 37 Seven days you shall perform purification for the altar to consecrate it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become consecrated.
content_old: 37 Seven days you shall perform purification for the altar to consecrate it, and the altar shall become most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become consecrated.

content: 38 Now this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, regularly.
content_old: 38 Now this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, regularly.

content: 39 You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight.
content_old: 39 You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight.

content: 40 There shall be a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in, and a libation of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb;
content_old: 40 There shall be a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in, and a libation of a quarter hin of wine for one lamb;

content: 41 and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight, repeating with it the meal offering of the morning with its libation—an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the LORD,
content_old: 41 and you shall offer the other lamb at twilight, repeating with it the meal offering of the morning with its libation—an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to the LORD,

content: 42 a regular burnt offering throughout the generations, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before the LORD. For there I will meet with you, and there I will speak with you,
content_old: 42 a regular burnt offering throughout the generations, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before the LORD. For there I will meet with you, and there I will speak with you,

content: 43 and there I will meet with the Israelites, and it shall be sanctified by My Presence.
content_old: 43 and there I will meet with the Israelites, and it shall be sanctified by My Presence.

content: 44 I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.
content_old: 44 I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.

content: 45 I will abide among the Israelites, and I will be their God.
content_old: 45 I will abide among the Israelites, and I will be their God.

content: 1 You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.
content_old: 1 You shall make an altar for burning incense; make it of acacia wood.

content: 2 It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.
content_old: 2 It shall be a cubit long and a cubit wide—it shall be square—and two cubits high, its horns of one piece with it.

content: 3 Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.
content_old: 3 Overlay it with pure gold: its top, its sides round about, and its horns; and make a gold molding for it round about.

content: 4 And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on opposite sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.
content_old: 4 And make two gold rings for it under its molding; make them on its two side walls, on opposite sides. They shall serve as holders for poles with which to carry it.

content: 5 Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
content_old: 5 Make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

content: 6 Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.
content_old: 6 Place it in front of the curtain that is over the Ark of the Pact—in front of the cover that is over the Pact—where I will meet with you.

content: 7 On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,
content_old: 7 On it Aaron shall burn aromatic incense: he shall burn it every morning when he tends the lamps,

content: 8 and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before the LORD throughout the ages.
content_old: 8 and Aaron shall burn it at twilight when he lights the lamps—a regular incense offering before the LORD throughout the ages.

content: 9 You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.
content_old: 9 You shall not offer alien incense on it, or a burnt offering or a meal offering; neither shall you pour a libation on it.

content: 10 Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to the LORD.
content_old: 10 Once a year Aaron shall perform purification upon its horns with blood of the sin offering of purification; purification shall be performed upon it once a year throughout the ages. It is most holy to the LORD.

content: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 11 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 12 When you take a census of the Israelite people according to their enrollment, each shall pay the LORD a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.
content_old: 12 When you take a census of the Israelite people according to their enrollment, each shall pay the LORD a ransom for himself on being enrolled, that no plague may come upon them through their being enrolled.

content: 13 This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to the LORD.
content_old: 13 This is what everyone who is entered in the records shall pay: a half-shekel by the sanctuary weight—twenty gerahs to the shekel—a half-shekel as an offering to the LORD.

content: 14 Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give the LORD‘s offering:
content_old: 14 Everyone who is entered in the records, from the age of twenty years up, shall give the LORD‘s offering:

content: 15 the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving the LORD‘s offering as expiation for your persons.
content_old: 15 the rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than half a shekel when giving the LORD‘s offering as expiation for your persons.

content: 16 You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before the LORD, as expiation for your persons.
content_old: 16 You shall take the expiation money from the Israelites and assign it to the service of the Tent of Meeting; it shall serve the Israelites as a reminder before the LORD, as expiation for your persons.

content: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 17 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 18 Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,
content_old: 18 Make a laver of copper and a stand of copper for it, for washing; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar. Put water in it,

content: 19 and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet from it.
content_old: 19 and let Aaron and his sons wash their hands and feet from it.

content: 20 When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to the LORD,
content_old: 20 When they enter the Tent of Meeting they shall wash with water, that they may not die; or when they approach the altar to serve, to turn into smoke an offering by fire to the LORD,

content: 21 they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.
content_old: 21 they shall wash their hands and feet, that they may not die. It shall be a law for all time for them—for him and his offspring—throughout the ages.

content: 22 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
content_old: 22 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

content: 23 Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidified myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,
content_old: 23 Next take choice spices: five hundred weight of solidified myrrh, half as much—two hundred and fifty—of fragrant cinnamon, two hundred and fifty of aromatic cane,

content: 24 five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.
content_old: 24 five hundred—by the sanctuary weight—of cassia, and a hin of olive oil.

content: 25 Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.
content_old: 25 Make of this a sacred anointing oil, a compound of ingredients expertly blended, to serve as sacred anointing oil.

content: 26 With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,
content_old: 26 With it anoint the Tent of Meeting, the Ark of the Pact,

content: 27 the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,
content_old: 27 the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and all its fittings, the altar of incense,

content: 28 the altar of burnt offering and all its ut utensils, and the laver and its stand.
content_old: 28 the altar of burnt offering and all its ut utensils, and the laver and its stand.

content: 29 Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.
content_old: 29 Thus you shall consecrate them so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be consecrated.

content: 30 You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.
content_old: 30 You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, consecrating them to serve Me as priests.

content: 31 And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.
content_old: 31 And speak to the Israelite people, as follows: This shall be an anointing oil sacred to Me throughout the ages.

content: 32 It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.
content_old: 32 It must not be rubbed on any person’s body, and you must not make anything like it in the same proportions; it is sacred, to be held sacred by you.

content: 33 Whoever compounds its like, or puts any of it on a layman, shall be cut off from his kin.
content_old: 33 Whoever compounds its like, or puts any of it on a layman, shall be cut off from his kin.

content: 34 And the LORD said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.
content_old: 34 And the LORD said to Moses: Take the herbs stacte, onycha, and galbanum—these herbs together with pure frankincense; let there be an equal part of each.

content: 35 Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.
content_old: 35 Make them into incense, a compound expertly blended, refined, pure, sacred.

content: 36 Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
content_old: 36 Beat some of it into powder, and put some before the Pact in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.

content: 37 But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to the LORD.
content_old: 37 But when you make this incense, you must not make any in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be held by you sacred to the LORD.

content: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses:
content_old: 1 The LORD spoke to Moses:

content: 2 See, I have singled out by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
content_old: 2 See, I have singled out by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

content: 3 I have endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft;
content_old: 3 I have endowed him with a divine spirit of skill, ability, and knowledge in every kind of craft;

content: 4 to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,
content_old: 4 to make designs for work in gold, silver, and copper,

content: 5 to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of craft.
content_old: 5 to cut stones for setting and to carve wood—to work in every kind of craft.

content: 6 Moreover, I have assigned to him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have also granted skill to all who are skillful, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:
content_old: 6 Moreover, I have assigned to him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have also granted skill to all who are skillful, that they may make everything that I have commanded you:

content: 7 the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Pact and the cover upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tent;
content_old: 7 the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Pact and the cover upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tent;

content: 8 the table and its utensils, the pure lampstand and all its fittings, and the altar of incense;
content_old: 8 the table and its utensils, the pure lampstand and all its fittings, and the altar of incense;

content: 9 the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;
content_old: 9 the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand;

content: 10 the service vestments, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests;
content_old: 10 the service vestments, the sacral vestments of Aaron the priest and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests;

content: 11 as well as the anointing oil and the aromatic incense for the sanctuary. Just as I have commanded you, they shall do.
content_old: 11 as well as the anointing oil and the aromatic incense for the sanctuary. Just as I have commanded you, they shall do.

content: 12 And the LORD said to Moses:
content_old: 12 And the LORD said to Moses:

content: 13 Speak to the Israelite people and say: Nevertheless, you must keep My sabbaths, for this is a sign between Me and you throughout the ages, that you may know that I the LORD have consecrated you.
content_old: 13 Speak to the Israelite people and say: Nevertheless, you must keep My sabbaths, for this is a sign between Me and you throughout the ages, that you may know that I the LORD have consecrated you.

content: 14 You shall keep the sabbath, for it is holy for you. He who profanes it shall be put to death: whoever does work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his kin.
content_old: 14 You shall keep the sabbath, for it is holy for you. He who profanes it shall be put to death: whoever does work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his kin.

content: 15 Six days may work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, holy to the LORD; whoever does work on the sabbath day shall be put to death.
content_old: 15 Six days may work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, holy to the LORD; whoever does work on the sabbath day shall be put to death.

content: 16 The Israelite people shall keep the sabbath, observing the sabbath throughout the ages as a covenant for all time:
content_old: 16 The Israelite people shall keep the sabbath, observing the sabbath throughout the ages as a covenant for all time:

content: 17 it shall be a sign for all time between Me and the people of Israel. For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day He ceased from work and was refreshed.
content_old: 17 it shall be a sign for all time between Me and the people of Israel. For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day He ceased from work and was refreshed.

content: 1 When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, the people gathered against Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who shall go before us, for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.”
content_old: 1 When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, the people gathered against Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who shall go before us, for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.”

content: 2 Aaron said to them, “Take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
content_old: 2 Aaron said to them, “Take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”

content: 3 And all the people took off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
content_old: 3 And all the people took off the gold rings that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.

content: 4 This he took from them and cast in a mold, and made it into a molten calf. And they exclaimed, “This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!”
content_old: 4 This he took from them and cast in a mold, and made it into a molten calf. And they exclaimed, “This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!”

content: 5 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron announced: “Tomorrow shall be a festival of the LORD!”
content_old: 5 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron announced: “Tomorrow shall be a festival of the LORD!”

content: 6 Early next day, the people offered up burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being; they sat down to eat and drink, and then rose to dance.
content_old: 6 Early next day, the people offered up burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being; they sat down to eat and drink, and then rose to dance.

content: 7 The LORD spoke to Moses, “Hurry down, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have acted basely.
content_old: 7 The LORD spoke to Moses, “Hurry down, for your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt, have acted basely.

content: 8 They have been quick to turn aside from the way that I enjoined upon them. They have made themselves a molten calf and bowed low to it and sacrificed to it, saying: ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!’ ”
content_old: 8 They have been quick to turn aside from the way that I enjoined upon them. They have made themselves a molten calf and bowed low to it and sacrificed to it, saying: ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you out of the land of Egypt!’ ”

content: 9 The LORD further said to Moses, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.
content_old: 9 The LORD further said to Moses, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.

content: 10 Now, let Me be, that My anger may blaze forth against them and that I may destroy them, and make of you a great nation.”
content_old: 10 Now, let Me be, that My anger may blaze forth against them and that I may destroy them, and make of you a great nation.”

content: 11 But Moses implored the LORD his God, saying, “Let not Your anger, O Lord, blaze forth against Your people, whom You delivered from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand.
content_old: 11 But Moses implored the LORD his God, saying, “Let not Your anger, O Lord, blaze forth against Your people, whom You delivered from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand.

content: 12 Let not the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that He delivered them, only to kill them off in the mountains and annihilate them from the face of the earth.’ Turn from Your blazing anger, and renounce the plan to punish Your people.
content_old: 12 Let not the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that He delivered them, only to kill them off in the mountains and annihilate them from the face of the earth.’ Turn from Your blazing anger, and renounce the plan to punish Your people.

content: 13 Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, how You swore to them by Your Self and said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and I will give to your offspring this whole land of which I spoke, to possess forever.”
content_old: 13 Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, how You swore to them by Your Self and said to them: I will make your offspring as numerous as the stars of heaven, and I will give to your offspring this whole land of which I spoke, to possess forever.”

content: 14 And the LORD renounced the punishment He had planned to bring upon His people.
content_old: 14 And the LORD renounced the punishment He had planned to bring upon His people.

content: 15 Thereupon Moses turned and went down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, tablets inscribed on both their surfaces: they were inscribed on the one side and on the other.
content_old: 15 Thereupon Moses turned and went down from the mountain bearing the two tablets of the Pact, tablets inscribed on both their surfaces: they were inscribed on the one side and on the other.

content: 16 The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing, incised upon the tablets.
content_old: 16 The tablets were God’s work, and the writing was God’s writing, incised upon the tablets.

content: 17 When Joshua heard the sound of the people in its boisterousness, he said to Moses, “There is a cry of war in the camp.”
content_old: 17 When Joshua heard the sound of the people in its boisterousness, he said to Moses, “There is a cry of war in the camp.”

content: 18 But he answered, “It is not the sound of the tune of triumph, Or the sound of the tune of defeat; It is the sound of song that I hear!”
content_old: 18 But he answered, “It is not the sound of the tune of triumph, Or the sound of the tune of defeat; It is the sound of song that I hear!”

content: 19 As soon as Moses came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became enraged; and he hurled the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.
content_old: 19 As soon as Moses came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he became enraged; and he hurled the tablets from his hands and shattered them at the foot of the mountain.

content: 20 He took the calf that they had made and burned it; he ground it to powder and strewed it upon the water and so made the Israelites drink it.
content_old: 20 He took the calf that they had made and burned it; he ground it to powder and strewed it upon the water and so made the Israelites drink it.

content: 21 Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such great sin upon them?”
content_old: 21 Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought such great sin upon them?”

content: 22 Aaron said, “Let not my lord be enraged. You know that this people is bent on evil.
content_old: 22 Aaron said, “Let not my lord be enraged. You know that this people is bent on evil.

content: 23 They said to me, ‘Make us a god to lead us; for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’
content_old: 23 They said to me, ‘Make us a god to lead us; for that man Moses, who brought us from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’

content: 24 So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off!’ They gave it to me and I hurled it into the fire and out came this calf!”
content_old: 24 So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off!’ They gave it to me and I hurled it into the fire and out came this calf!”

content: 25 Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control—so that they were a menace to any who might oppose them.
content_old: 25 Moses saw that the people were out of control—since Aaron had let them get out of control—so that they were a menace to any who might oppose them.

content: 26 Moses stood up in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is for the LORD, come here!” And all the Levites rallied to him.
content_old: 26 Moses stood up in the gate of the camp and said, “Whoever is for the LORD, come here!” And all the Levites rallied to him.

content: 27 He said to them, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Each of you put sword on thigh, go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay brother, neighbor, and kin.”
content_old: 27 He said to them, “Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel: Each of you put sword on thigh, go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay brother, neighbor, and kin.”

content: 28 The Levites did as Moses had bidden; and some three thousand of the people fell that day.
content_old: 28 The Levites did as Moses had bidden; and some three thousand of the people fell that day.

content: 29 And Moses said, “Dedicate yourselves to the LORD this day—for each of you has been against son and brother—that He may bestow a blessing upon you today.”
content_old: 29 And Moses said, “Dedicate yourselves to the LORD this day—for each of you has been against son and brother—that He may bestow a blessing upon you today.”

content: 30 The next day Moses said to the people, “You have been guilty of a great sin. Yet I will now go up to the LORD; perhaps I may win forgiveness for your sin.”
content_old: 30 The next day Moses said to the people, “You have been guilty of a great sin. Yet I will now go up to the LORD; perhaps I may win forgiveness for your sin.”

content: 31 Moses went back to the LORD and said, “Alas, this people is guilty of a great sin in making for themselves a god of gold.
content_old: 31 Moses went back to the LORD and said, “Alas, this people is guilty of a great sin in making for themselves a god of gold.

content: 32 Now, if You will forgive their sin ; but if not, erase me from the record which You have written!”
content_old: 32 Now, if You will forgive their sin ; but if not, erase me from the record which You have written!”

content: 33 But the LORD said to Moses, “He who has sinned against Me, him only will I erase from My record.
content_old: 33 But the LORD said to Moses, “He who has sinned against Me, him only will I erase from My record.

content: 34 Go now, lead the people where I told you. See, My angel shall go before you. But when I make an accounting, I will bring them to account for their sins.”
content_old: 34 Go now, lead the people where I told you. See, My angel shall go before you. But when I make an accounting, I will bring them to account for their sins.”

content: 1 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Set out from here, you and the people that you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring will I give it’—
content_old: 1 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Set out from here, you and the people that you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring will I give it’—

content: 2 I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—
content_old: 2 I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—

content: 3 a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go in your midst, since you are a stiffnecked people, lest I destroy you on the way.”
content_old: 3 a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go in your midst, since you are a stiffnecked people, lest I destroy you on the way.”

content: 4 When the people heard this harsh word, they went into mourning, and none put on his finery.
content_old: 4 When the people heard this harsh word, they went into mourning, and none put on his finery.

content: 5 The LORD said to Moses, “Say to the Israelite people, ‘You are a stiffnecked people. If I were to go in your midst for one moment, I would destroy you. Now, then, leave off your finery, and I will consider what to do to you.’ ”
content_old: 5 The LORD said to Moses, “Say to the Israelite people, ‘You are a stiffnecked people. If I were to go in your midst for one moment, I would destroy you. Now, then, leave off your finery, and I will consider what to do to you.’ ”

content: 6 So the Israelites remained stripped of the finery from Mount Horeb on.
content_old: 6 So the Israelites remained stripped of the finery from Mount Horeb on.

content: 7 Now Moses would take the Tent and pitch it outside the camp, at some distance from the camp. It was called the Tent of Meeting, and whoever sought the LORD would go out to the Tent of Meeting that was outside the camp.
content_old: 7 Now Moses would take the Tent and pitch it outside the camp, at some distance from the camp. It was called the Tent of Meeting, and whoever sought the LORD would go out to the Tent of Meeting that was outside the camp.

content: 8 Whenever Moses went out to the Tent, all the people would rise and stand, each at the entrance of his tent, and gaze after Moses until he had entered the Tent.
content_old: 8 Whenever Moses went out to the Tent, all the people would rise and stand, each at the entrance of his tent, and gaze after Moses until he had entered the Tent.

content: 9 And when Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the Tent, while He spoke with Moses.
content_old: 9 And when Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the Tent, while He spoke with Moses.

content: 10 When all the people saw the pillar of cloud poised at the entrance of the Tent, all the people would rise and bow low, each at the entrance of his tent.
content_old: 10 When all the people saw the pillar of cloud poised at the entrance of the Tent, all the people would rise and bow low, each at the entrance of his tent.

content: 11 The LORD would speak to Moses face to face, as one man speaks to another. And he would then return to the camp; but his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, a youth, would not stir out of the Tent.
content_old: 11 The LORD would speak to Moses face to face, as one man speaks to another. And he would then return to the camp; but his attendant, Joshua son of Nun, a youth, would not stir out of the Tent.

content: 12 Moses said to the LORD, “See, You say to me, ‘Lead this people forward,’ but You have not made known to me whom You will send with me. Further, You have said, ‘I have singled you out by name, and you have, indeed, gained My favor.’
content_old: 12 Moses said to the LORD, “See, You say to me, ‘Lead this people forward,’ but You have not made known to me whom You will send with me. Further, You have said, ‘I have singled you out by name, and you have, indeed, gained My favor.’

content: 13 Now, if I have truly gained Your favor, pray let me know Your ways, that I may know You and continue in Your favor. Consider, too, that this nation is Your people.”
content_old: 13 Now, if I have truly gained Your favor, pray let me know Your ways, that I may know You and continue in Your favor. Consider, too, that this nation is Your people.”

content: 14 And He said, “I will go in the lead and will lighten your burden.”
content_old: 14 And He said, “I will go in the lead and will lighten your burden.”

content: 15 And he said to Him, “Unless You go in the lead, do not make us leave this place.
content_old: 15 And he said to Him, “Unless You go in the lead, do not make us leave this place.

content: 16 For how shall it be known that Your people have gained Your favor unless You go with us, so that we may be distinguished, Your people and I, from every people on the face of the earth?”
content_old: 16 For how shall it be known that Your people have gained Your favor unless You go with us, so that we may be distinguished, Your people and I, from every people on the face of the earth?”

content: 17 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked; for you have truly gained My favor and I have singled you out by name.”
content_old: 17 And the LORD said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked; for you have truly gained My favor and I have singled you out by name.”

content: 18 He said, “Oh, let me behold Your Presence!”
content_old: 18 He said, “Oh, let me behold Your Presence!”

content: 19 And He answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim before you the name LORD, and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show.
content_old: 19 And He answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim before you the name LORD, and the grace that I grant and the compassion that I show.

content: 20 But,” He said, “you cannot see My face, for man may not see Me and live.”
content_old: 20 But,” He said, “you cannot see My face, for man may not see Me and live.”

content: 21 And the LORD said, “See, there is a place near Me. Station yourself on the rock
content_old: 21 And the LORD said, “See, there is a place near Me. Station yourself on the rock

content: 22 and, as My Presence passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and shield you with My hand until I have passed by.
content_old: 22 and, as My Presence passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and shield you with My hand until I have passed by.

content: 1 The LORD said to Moses: “Carve two tablets of stone like the first, and I will inscribe upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you shattered.
content_old: 1 The LORD said to Moses: “Carve two tablets of stone like the first, and I will inscribe upon the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you shattered.

content: 2 Be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to Me, on the top of the mountain.
content_old: 2 Be ready by morning, and in the morning come up to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to Me, on the top of the mountain.

content: 3 No one else shall come up with you, and no one else shall be seen anywhere on the mountain; neither shall the flocks and the herds graze at the foot of this mountain.”
content_old: 3 No one else shall come up with you, and no one else shall be seen anywhere on the mountain; neither shall the flocks and the herds graze at the foot of this mountain.”

content: 4 So Moses carved two tablets of stone, like the first, and early in the morning he went up on Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, taking the two stone tablets with him.
content_old: 4 So Moses carved two tablets of stone, like the first, and early in the morning he went up on Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, taking the two stone tablets with him.

content: 5 The LORD came down in a cloud; He stood with him there, and proclaimed the name LORD.
content_old: 5 The LORD came down in a cloud; He stood with him there, and proclaimed the name LORD.

content: 6 The LORD passed before him and proclaimed: “The LORD! the LORD! a God compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in kindness and faithfulness,
content_old: 6 The LORD passed before him and proclaimed: “The LORD! the LORD! a God compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in kindness and faithfulness,

content: 7 extending kindness to the thousandth generation, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin; yet He does not remit all punishment, but visits the iniquity of parents upon children and children’s children, upon the third and fourth generations.”
content_old: 7 extending kindness to the thousandth generation, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin; yet He does not remit all punishment, but visits the iniquity of parents upon children and children’s children, upon the third and fourth generations.”

content: 8 Moses hastened to bow low to the ground in homage,
content_old: 8 Moses hastened to bow low to the ground in homage,

content: 9 and said, “If I have gained Your favor, O Lord, pray, let the Lord go in our midst, even though this is a stiffnecked people. Pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your own!”
content_old: 9 and said, “If I have gained Your favor, O Lord, pray, let the Lord go in our midst, even though this is a stiffnecked people. Pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for Your own!”

content: 10 He said: I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will work such wonders as have not been wrought on all the earth or in any nation; and all the people who are with you shall see how awesome are the LORD‘s deeds which I will perform for you.
content_old: 10 He said: I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will work such wonders as have not been wrought on all the earth or in any nation; and all the people who are with you shall see how awesome are the LORD‘s deeds which I will perform for you.

content: 11 Mark well what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
content_old: 11 Mark well what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

content: 12 Beware of making a covenant with the inhabitants of the land against which you are advancing, lest they be a snare in your midst.
content_old: 12 Beware of making a covenant with the inhabitants of the land against which you are advancing, lest they be a snare in your midst.

content: 13 No, you must tear down their altars, smash their pillars, and cut down their sacred posts;
content_old: 13 No, you must tear down their altars, smash their pillars, and cut down their sacred posts;

content: 14 for you must not worship any other god, because the LORD, whose name is Impassioned, is an impassioned God.
content_old: 14 for you must not worship any other god, because the LORD, whose name is Impassioned, is an impassioned God.

content: 15 You must not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for they will lust after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and invite you, and you will eat of their sacrifices.
content_old: 15 You must not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for they will lust after their gods and sacrifice to their gods and invite you, and you will eat of their sacrifices.
